data-reactid="26"/><link data-react-helmet="true" rel="amphtml" href="http://amp.timeinc.net/time/4682990/muhammad-ali-son-detained-airport/?source=dam" data-reactid="27"/><script data-react-helmet="true" type="application/ld+json" data-reactid="28">{"@context":"http://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":{"@type":"WebPage","@id":"http://time.com/4682990/muhammad-ali-son-detained-airport/"},"headline":"Muhammad Ali&#x27;s Son Detained at Airport and Was Asked &#x27;Are you Muslim?&#x27;","url":"http://time.com/4682990/muhammad-ali-son-detained-airport/","dateCreated":"2017-02-25T21:47:43","datePublished":"2017-02-25T21:47:43","dateModified":"2017-02-25T21:22:00","creator":["Bruce Schreiner / AP"],"keywords":["florida"],"author":["Bruce Schreiner / AP"],"publisher":{"@type":"Organization","name":"Time","logo":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"http://assets.time.com/brandlogos/time.png","height":42,"width":128}},"articleBody":"Muhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday. Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney. Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said. &#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221; Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention. An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials. During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said. Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S. &#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221; Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said. Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide.","articleSection":"U.S.","image":{"@type":"ImageObject","url":"https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2017/02/muhammad_ali_jr.jpg?quality=85"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://timedotcom.files.wordpress.com/2017/02/muhammad_ali_jr.jpg?quality=85"}</script><link data-reactid="231"><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="232"><!-- react-text: 233 -->Muhammad Ali&#x27;s son, who bears the boxing great&#x27;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="234"><!-- react-text: 235 -->Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="236"><!-- react-text: 237 -->Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father — a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.<!-- /react-text --></p><div class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2" data-reactid="238"><div class="row _2Cq4HVTu" data-reactid="239"><div id="ad-300x250_1" data-reactid="240"></div></div></div><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="241"><!-- react-text: 242 -->Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#x27;s Ali&#x27;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#x27;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said.<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="243"><!-- react-text: 244 -->&quot;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#x27;re a Muslim,&quot; Mancini said in a phone interview. &quot;It&#x27;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&quot;<!-- /react-text --></p><p class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2  _10M0Ygc4" data-reactid="245"><!-- react-text: 246 -->Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &quot;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&quot; according to The Courier-Journal&#x27;s report about the detention.<!-- /react-text --></p><div class="column small-12 medium-10 medium-offset-1 large-offset-2" data-reactid="247"><div class="row _2Cq4HVTu" data-reactid="248"><div id="ad-300x250_2" data-reactid="249"></div></div></div><div class="column small-12 _2Yxaw5JM" data-reactid="250"><div class="row" data-reactid="251"><div class="_2eP5eWqX" 32'><path d='M3 2.36h23.67v5.4h-.43l.05-3.46h-9.35v24.36h2.7v.8H10.4v-.8h2.5V4.3H3.45v3.46H3v-5.4zM27.8 2.36h9.3v.75h-2.65v25.56h2.64v.8h-9.3v-.8h2.7V3.1h-2.7v-.74zM45.3 2.3h1.78l8.7 20.9 Health","description":"For more, visit \u003Ca href=\"\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Ftime-health\u002F\"\u003ETIME Health\u003C\u002Fa\u003E."}},"isProduction":true},"env":"production"},"auth":{"isLoaded":true,"isVisible":false,"cookiePrefix":"ti-verify","authFlag":false},"betaTest":{"isLoaded":false,"cookiePrefix":"time-beta","cookies":{}},"contentContainerWithBackgroundImage":{"bgImage":false},"dataService":{"loaded":false},"editorialArticle":{"loaded":true,"loading":false,"data":{"id":4682990,"date":"2017-02-25T16:47:43","date_gmt":"2017-02-25T21:47:43","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?p=4682990"},"modified":"2017-02-25T16:22:00","modified_gmt":"2017-02-25T21:22:00","slug":"muhammad-ali-son-detained-airport","type":"post","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4682990\u002Fmuhammad-ali-son-detained-airport\u002F","title":{"rendered":"Muhammad Ali's Son Detained at Airport and Was Asked 'Are you Muslim?'"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EMuhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReturning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECamacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAn airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDuring his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECamacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Muhammad Ali's son, who bears the boxing great's name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father — a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he's Ali's son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they're Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they're a Muslim,\" Mancini said in a phone interview. \"It's quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: \"Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,\" according to The Courier-Journal's report about the detention."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, \"as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,\" Mancini said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump's efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"This has never happened to them before,\" Mancini said. \"They're asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they're Muslims. It doesn't take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson's disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city's most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide."]}],"plain":"Muhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday. Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney. Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said. &#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221; Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention. An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials. During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said. Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S. &#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221; Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said. Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion,&#8221; a family friend and lawyer said\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":108310934,"featured_media":4682999,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[1657],"time_section":[204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937772],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4682990"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4682990"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4682990"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:authors":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune:newsletter":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fnew nation","parent":0,"count":11631,"filter":"raw","all_sections":["us"]}],"fortune:primary_topic":[{}],"fortune:related":[[{"id":4682990,"date":"2017-02-25T16:47:43","date_gmt":"2017-02-25T21:47:43","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?p=4682990"},"modified":"2017-02-25T16:22:00","modified_gmt":"2017-02-25T21:22:00","slug":"muhammad-ali-son-detained-airport","type":"post","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4682990\u002Fmuhammad-ali-son-detained-airport\u002F","title":{"rendered":"Muhammad Ali's Son Detained at Airport and Was Asked 'Are you Muslim?'"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EMuhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReturning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECamacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAn airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDuring his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECamacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Muhammad Ali's son, who bears the boxing great's name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father — a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he's Ali's son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they're Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they're a Muslim,\" Mancini said in a phone interview. \"It's quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: \"Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,\" according to The Courier-Journal's report about the detention."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, \"as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,\" Mancini said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump's efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"This has never happened to them before,\" Mancini said. \"They're asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they're Muslims. It doesn't take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson's disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city's most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide."]}],"plain":"Muhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday. Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney. Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said. &#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221; Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention. An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials. During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said. Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S. &#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221; Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said. Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion,&#8221; a family friend and lawyer said\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":108310934,"featured_media":4682999,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[1657],"time_section":[204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937772],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4682990"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4682990"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4682990"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4682990\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune:newsletter":[{"href":" Who Shot 73-Year-Old Woman During Training Course Charged in Her Death"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EA Florida police chief has been charged with negligence and one of his officers was charged with manslaughter six months after a 73-year-old woman was \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4446605\u002Fmary-knowlton-florida-punta-gorda-police-shooting\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eaccidentally shot dead during a civilian police academy course\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EPunta Gorda Police Chief Tom Lewis and police officer Lee Coel, who \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4446230\u002Fflorida-punta-gorda-librarian-shot\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Efatally fired\u003C\u002Fa\u003E at Mary Knowlton, both face charges in the August 2016 shooting, prosecutors said Wednesday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EKnowlton, a longtime librarian, was participating in a role-playing exercise at the Punta Gorda, Fla. police station when Coel &#8220;mistakenly&#8221; shot her, authorities said at the time. The exercise was meant to teach students when to shoot and when not to shoot during lethal force situations.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECoel, 28, could receive up to 30 years in prison for the felony manslaughter charge, according to the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.usatoday.com\u002Fstory\u002Fnews\u002Fnation-now\u002F2017\u002F02\u002F22\u002F2-cops-charged-florida-womans-accidental-shooting-death\u002F98269012\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ENaples \u003Cem\u003EDaily News\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. His lawyer, Jerry Berry, said Coel didn&rsquo;t know the gun had live ammunition in it, \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.winknews.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002F22\u002Fruling-expected-in-punta-gorda-citizens-academy-shooting\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EWINK News\u003C\u002Fa\u003E reported. Lewis, who was charged with a misdemeanor count of culpable negligence, faces up to 60 days in jail.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESteve Knowlton, one of Mary Knowlton&rsquo;s two sons, told TIME in August that he was struggling with his anger toward the officer who shot his mother, because she taught him not to &ldquo;harbor hate.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;I know the police officer didn&rsquo;t intentionally do it, but it just feels like our souls got ripped out of our chest,&rdquo; he said at the time. &ldquo;It just turned everything upside down.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["A Florida police chief has been charged with negligence and one of his officers was charged with manslaughter six months after a 73-year-old woman was ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4446605\u002Fmary-knowlton-florida-punta-gorda-police-shooting\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["accidentally shot dead during a civilian police academy course"]},"."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Punta Gorda Police Chief Tom Lewis and police officer Lee Coel, who ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4446230\u002Fflorida-punta-gorda-librarian-shot\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["fatally fired"]}," at Mary Knowlton, both face charges in the August 2016 shooting, prosecutors said Wednesday."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Knowlton, a longtime librarian, was participating in a role-playing exercise at the Punta Gorda, Fla. police station when Coel \"mistakenly\" shot her, authorities said at the time. The exercise was meant to teach students when to shoot and when not to shoot during lethal force situations."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Coel, 28, could receive up to 30 years in prison for the felony manslaughter charge, according to the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.usatoday.com\u002Fstory\u002Fnews\u002Fnation-now\u002F2017\u002F02\u002F22\u002F2-cops-charged-florida-womans-accidental-shooting-death\u002F98269012\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Naples ",{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Daily News"]}]},". His lawyer, Jerry Berry, said Coel didn’t know the gun had live ammunition in it, ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.winknews.com\u002F2017\u002F02\u002F22\u002Fruling-expected-in-punta-gorda-citizens-academy-shooting\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["WINK News"]}," reported. Lewis, who was charged with a misdemeanor count of culpable negligence, faces up to 60 days in jail."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Steve Knowlton, one of Mary Knowlton’s two sons, told TIME in August that he was struggling with his anger toward the officer who shot his mother, because she taught him not to “harbor hate.”"]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["“I know the police officer didn’t intentionally do it, but it just feels like our souls got ripped out of our chest,” he said at the time. “It just turned everything upside down.”"]}],"plain":"A Florida police chief has been charged with negligence and one of his officers was charged with manslaughter six months after a 73-year-old woman was accidentally shot dead during a civilian police academy course. Punta Gorda Police Chief Tom Lewis and police officer Lee Coel, who fatally fired at Mary Knowlton, both face charges in the August 2016 shooting, prosecutors said Wednesday. Knowlton, a longtime librarian, was participating in a role-playing exercise at the Punta Gorda, Fla. police station when Coel &#8220;mistakenly&#8221; shot her, authorities said at the time. The exercise was meant to teach students when to shoot and when not to shoot during lethal force situations. Coel, 28, could receive up to 30 years in prison for the felony manslaughter charge, according to the Naples Daily News. His lawyer, Jerry Berry, said Coel didn&rsquo;t know the gun had live ammunition in it, WINK News reported. Lewis, who was charged with a misdemeanor count of culpable negligence, faces up to 60 days in jail. Steve Knowlton, one of Mary Knowlton&rsquo;s two sons, told TIME in August that he was struggling with his anger toward the officer who shot his mother, because she taught him not to &ldquo;harbor hate.&rdquo; &ldquo;I know the police officer didn&rsquo;t intentionally do it, but it just feels like our souls got ripped out of our chest,&rdquo; he said at the time. &ldquo;It just turned everything upside down.&rdquo;"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe woman was mistakenly shot dead last year during a civilian police media\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and promising to take his message directly to the American people.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWeeks after his top aide coined the term \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4642689\u002Fkellyanne-conway-sean-spicer-donald-trump-alternative-facts\u002F\"\u003E&ldquo;alternative facts,&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Trump delivered what amounted to an alternative news report to the American people.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;The White House is running so smoothly,&rdquo; he said with dramatic flair, \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4670930\u002Fwhite-house-president-trump-asked-for-flynns-resignation\u002F\"\u003Edays after firing his National Security Advisor\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and as he \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4675975\u002Fdonald-trump-national-security-picks\u002F\"\u003Estruggles to find a replacement\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. He sought to explain away court rulings enjoining the enforcement on his \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4652552\u002Fpresident-trump-is-suspending-a-refugee-program-and-banning-visas-from-7-countries\u002F\"\u003Econtroversial travel ban\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673772\u002Fdonald-trump-republicans-congress-agenda\u002F\"\u003Esnail&#8217;s pace legislative agenda rollout\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMost presidents look to govern for a bit before returning to the campaign trail, but Trump isn&rsquo;t most presidents.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;Life is a campaign,&rdquo; Trump told reporters aboard Air Force One on his 30th day in office, as he made the brief flight up the Florida coast from the &#8220;Winter White House,&#8221; his Mar-a-Lago club. &ldquo;Making our country great again is a campaign. For me it&#8217;s a campaign, to make America great again is absolutely a campaign.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EComing on the heels of a \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4673624\u002Fdonald-trump-press-conference-combative\u002F\"\u003Emarathon press conference\u003C\u002Fa\u003E on Thursday in which he mocked and pleaded with the news media over their coverage of his campaign, the rally was another opportunity for the president to do what he has always done best: serve as his own pitchman.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe fiery speech in a humid aircraft hangar on Florida&rsquo;s space coast was unmistakably Trump. Alternately reading from a teleprompter and seemingly winging it, Trump said he wanted to speak to his supporters and the broader American public &ldquo;without the filter of the fake news.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe phrase has become a catch-all assault on the free press from the President designed to rally his followers to ignore reports of dysfunction in his administration. In a Friday tweet, Trump declared mainstream news outlets like the New York \u003Cem\u003ETimes\u003C\u002Fem\u003E and CNN &ldquo;the enemy of the American People.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"time-embed time-embed__twitter\" data-provider=\"twitter\" data-url=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FrealDonaldTrump\u002Fstatus\u002F832708293516632065\" \u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"embed-twitter\"\u003E\n\u003Cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\"\u003E\n\u003Cp lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\"\u003EThe FAKE NEWS media (failing \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002Fnytimes\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E@nytimes\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FNBCNews\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E@NBCNews\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FABC\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E@ABC\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FCBS\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E@CBS\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FCNN\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E@CNN\u003C\u002Fa\u003E) is not my enemy, it is the enemy of the American People!\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&mdash; Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FrealDonaldTrump\u002Fstatus\u002F832708293516632065\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EFebruary 17, 2017\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhite House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus told \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fcbs-203\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003ECBS\u003C\u002Fa\u003E \u003Ci\u003EFace the Nation\u003Cb\u003E \u003C\u002Fb\u003E\u003C\u002Fi\u003Eof Trump&rsquo;s comments on the press as the enemy, &ldquo;I think you should take it seriously.&rdquo; His chief strategist has repeatedly referred to the press as \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F2017\u002F01\u002F26\u002Fbusiness\u002Fmedia\u002Fstephen-bannon-trump-news-media.html?_r=0\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E&ldquo;the opposition party.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;We will continue to expose them for what they are,&rdquo; Trump told the crowd of 9,000 in Melbourne.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe venue previously hosted Trump&rsquo;s first rally after a rocky performance in the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4508703\u002Fpresidential-debate-hillary-clinton-donald-trump-hofstra-long-island\u002F\"\u003Efirst general election presidential debate\u003C\u002Fa\u003E in September 2016. Then too, he lashed out at the &ldquo;corrupt corporate media&rdquo; for panning his performance, as he claimed victory despite reputable polls showing he had lost and he himself blaming a defective microphone for knocking him off his game.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;We&rsquo;re doing good folks, we&rsquo;re going to do something that&rsquo;s never been done before,&rdquo; Trump maintained then.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMore than three months after he shocked the world with his White House win, Trump&rsquo;s message was much the same. Instead of electoral projections, it was job approval numbers. He promised swift progress on his multitude of campaign promises, like building a wall along the southern border and deporting people who are illegally in the U.S.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAll of it was red meat for his supporters, who chanted &#8220;CNN sucks&#8221; and &ldquo;fake news.&rdquo; After Trump departed, more than 100 Trump supporters crowded the media pen to chant, &ldquo;Tell the truth.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe rally was paid for by Trump&rsquo;s campaign, which reconstituted itself in January for the 2020 re-elect. Ever the showman, he called up a supporter to the stage who he&rsquo;d watched interviewed on cable news after showing up at 4 a.m. for the rally.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETrump won Brevard County, which includes Melbourne, by nearly 20 percentage points in November, outperforming Mitt Romney by about six percentage points from 2012.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe event was a jazzed-up highlights reel of Trump&rsquo;s familiar campaign rallies. Elton John&rsquo;s &#8220;Tiny Dancer,&#8221; Free&rsquo;s &#8220;All Right Now,&#8221; and Pavarotti&rsquo;s rendition of &#8220;Nessun Dorma&#8221; were in steady circulation as well as the song that became a de facto anthem for the new president, Frank Sinatra&rsquo;s &#8220;My Way.&#8221; On their way into the venue attendees were given the option of red &ldquo;Make America Great Again&rdquo; signs or pom-poms to hold during the rally. Outside, venders hawked Trump gear, including his signature red hats, while inside the campaign sold its own &#8220;45&#8221; swag. The local airport authority printed its own &ldquo;Let&rsquo;s Make America&rsquo;s Airports Great Again&rdquo; signs.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBut where Trump used to park his personal \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fboeing-24\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EBoeing\u003C\u002Fa\u003E 757 behind him as he spoke, now it was the iconic blue and white 747 of Air Force One. The plane taxied to the open hangar doors as the theme from the movie &ldquo;Air Force One&rdquo; blared from the sound system. The President and First Lady to Lee Greenwood&rsquo;s &lsquo;Proud to Be an American,&rdquo; as Trump waved a red baseball cap to the crowd.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMelania Trump delivered her most extensive remarks in public since the day her husband was sworn-in, leading the crowd in the Lord&rsquo;s Prayer and making an appeal &ldquo;greater civility and unity&rdquo; across the political divide. But even she had harsh words for the press, telling her husband&rsquo;s supporters. &ldquo;I will always be truthful to myself and truthful to you, no matter what the opposition is saying about me.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThere was little doubt that Trump enjoyed the adoration of his supporters, as he flashed thumbs-up signs and signed autographs before returning to Air Force One for the flight back to his weekend getaway.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETrump views rallies like Saturday&rsquo;s as part of the job of the president, an aide said, promoting the &ldquo;spirit&rdquo; of the American people. On Friday, a spokeswoman referred to the event as a &ldquo;a campaign rally for America,&rdquo; while a White House official said Trump expects to hold more rallies outside of Washington in the upcoming weeks.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The most unconventional president in generations kicked off his 2020 re-election campaign Saturday in Florida, ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4631556\u002Fdonald-trump-russia-fake-news-crap-sick-people\u002F"},"content":["railing against the “fake news” media"]}," and promising to take his message directly to the American people."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Weeks after his top aide coined the term ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4642689\u002Fkellyanne-conway-sean-spicer-donald-trump-alternative-facts\u002F"},"content":["“alternative facts,”"]}," Trump delivered what amounted to an alternative news report to the American people."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["“The White House is running so smoothly,” he said with dramatic flair, ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4670930\u002Fwhite-house-president-trump-asked-for-flynns-resignation\u002F"},"content":["days after firing his National Security Advisor"]}," and as he ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4675975\u002Fdonald-trump-national-security-picks\u002F"},"content":["struggles to find a replacement"]},". Instead of electoral projections, it was job approval numbers. He promised swift progress on his multitude of campaign promises, like building a wall along the southern border and deporting people who are illegally in the U.S."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["All of it was red meat for his supporters, who chanted \"CNN sucks\" and “fake news.” After Trump departed, more than 100 Trump supporters crowded the media pen to chant, “Tell the truth.”"]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The rally was paid for by Trump’s campaign, which reconstituted itself in January for the 2020 re-elect. Ever the showman, he called up a supporter to the stage who he’d watched interviewed on cable news after showing up at 4 a.m. for the rally."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Trump won Brevard County, which includes Melbourne, by nearly 20 percentage points in November, outperforming Mitt Romney by about six percentage points from 2012."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The event was a jazzed-up highlights reel of Trump’s familiar campaign rallies. Elton John’s \"Tiny Dancer,\" Free’s \"All Right Now,\" and Pavarotti’s rendition of \"Nessun Dorma\" were in steady circulation as well as the song that became a de facto anthem for the new president, Frank Sinatra’s \"My Way.\" On their way into the venue attendees were given the option of red “Make America Great Again” signs or pom-poms to hold during the rally. Outside, venders hawked Trump gear, including his signature red hats, while inside the campaign sold its own \"45\" swag. The local airport authority printed its own “Let’s Make America’s Airports Great Again” signs."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["But where Trump used to park his personal ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fboeing-24\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Boeing"]}," 757 behind him as he spoke, now it was the iconic blue and white 747 of Air Force One. The plane taxied to the open hangar doors as the theme from the movie “Air Force One” blared from the sound system. The President and First Lady to Lee Greenwood’s ‘Proud to Be an American,” as Trump waved a red baseball cap to the crowd."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Melania Trump delivered her most extensive remarks in public since the day her husband was sworn-in, leading the crowd in the Lord’s Prayer and making an appeal “greater civility and unity” across the political divide. But even she had harsh words for the press, telling her husband’s supporters. “I will always be truthful to myself and truthful to you, no matter what the opposition is saying about me.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["There was little doubt that Trump enjoyed the adoration of his supporters, as he flashed thumbs-up signs and signed autographs before returning to Air Force One for the flight back to his weekend getaway."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Trump views rallies like Saturday’s as part of the job of the president, an aide said, promoting the “spirit” of the American people. On Friday, a spokeswoman referred to the event as a “a campaign rally for America,” while a White House official said Trump expects to hold more rallies outside of Washington in the upcoming weeks."]}],"plain":"The most unconventional president in generations kicked off his 2020 re-election campaign Saturday in Florida, railing against the &ldquo;fake news&rdquo; media and promising to take his message directly to the American people. Weeks after his top aide coined the term &ldquo;alternative facts,&rdquo; Trump delivered what amounted to an alternative news report to the American people. &ldquo;The White House is running so smoothly,&rdquo; he said with dramatic flair, days after firing his National Security Advisor and as he struggles to find a replacement. He sought to explain away court rulings enjoining the enforcement on his controversial travel ban, the snail&#8217;s pace legislative agenda rollout. Most presidents look to govern for a bit before returning to the campaign trail, but Trump isn&rsquo;t most presidents. &#8220;Life is a campaign,&rdquo; Trump told reporters aboard Air Force One on his 30th day in office, as he made the brief flight up the Florida coast from the &#8220;Winter White House,&#8221; his Mar-a-Lago club. &ldquo;Making our country great again is a campaign. For me it&#8217;s a campaign, to make America great again is absolutely a campaign.&#8221; Coming on the heels of a marathon press conference on Thursday in which he mocked and pleaded with the news media over their coverage of his campaign, the rally was another opportunity for the president to do what he has always done best: serve as his own pitchman. The fiery speech in a humid aircraft hangar on Florida&rsquo;s space coast was unmistakably Trump. Alternately reading from a teleprompter and seemingly winging it, Trump said he wanted to speak to his supporters and the broader American public &ldquo;without the filter of the fake news.&rdquo; The phrase has become a catch-all assault on the free press from the President designed to rally his followers to ignore reports of dysfunction in his administration. In a Friday tweet, Trump declared mainstream news outlets like the New York Times and CNN &ldquo;the enemy of the American People.&rdquo; The FAKE NEWS media (failing @nytimes, @NBCNews, @ABC, @CBS, @CNN) is not my enemy, it is the enemy of the American People! &mdash; Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 17, 2017 White House Chief of Staff Reince Priebus told CBS Face the Nation of Trump&rsquo;s comments on the press as the enemy, &ldquo;I think you should take it seriously.&rdquo; His chief strategist has repeatedly referred to the press as &ldquo;the opposition party.&rdquo; &ldquo;We will continue to expose them for what they are,&rdquo; Trump told the crowd of 9,000 in Melbourne. The venue previously hosted Trump&rsquo;s first rally after a rocky performance in the first general election presidential debate in September 2016. Then too, he lashed out at the &ldquo;corrupt corporate media&rdquo; for panning his performance, as he claimed victory despite reputable polls showing he had lost and he himself blaming a defective microphone for knocking him off his game. &ldquo;We&rsquo;re doing good folks, we&rsquo;re going to do something that&rsquo;s never been done before,&rdquo; Trump maintained then. More than three months after he shocked the world with his White House win, Trump&rsquo;s message was much the same. Instead of electoral projections, it was job approval numbers. He promised swift progress on his multitude of campaign promises, like building a wall along the southern border and deporting people who are illegally in the U.S. All of it was red meat for his supporters, who chanted &#8220;CNN sucks&#8221; and &ldquo;fake news.&rdquo; After Trump departed, more than 100 Trump supporters crowded the media pen to chant, &ldquo;Tell the truth.&rdquo; The rally was paid for by Trump&rsquo;s campaign, which reconstituted itself in January for the 2020 re-elect. Ever the showman, he called up a supporter to the stage who he&rsquo;d watched interviewed on cable news after showing up at 4 a.m. for the rally. Trump won Brevard County, which includes Melbourne, by nearly 20 percentage points in November, outperforming Mitt Romney by about six percentage points from 2012. The event was a jazzed-up highlights reel of Trump&rsquo;s familiar campaign rallies. Elton John&rsquo;s &#8220;Tiny Dancer,&#8221; Free&rsquo;s &#8220;All Right Now,&#8221; and Pavarotti&rsquo;s rendition of &#8220;Nessun Dorma&#8221; were in steady circulation as well as the song that became a de facto anthem for the new president, Frank Sinatra&rsquo;s &#8220;My Way.&#8221; On their way into the venue attendees were given the option of red &ldquo;Make America Great Again&rdquo; signs or pom-poms to hold during the rally. Outside, venders hawked Trump gear, including his signature red hats, while inside the campaign sold its own &#8220;45&#8221; swag. The local airport authority printed its own &ldquo;Let&rsquo;s Make America&rsquo;s Airports Great Again&rdquo; signs. But where Trump used to park his personal Boeing 757 behind him as he spoke, now it was the iconic blue and white 747 of Air Force One. The plane taxied to the open hangar doors as the theme from the movie &ldquo;Air Force One&rdquo; blared from the sound system. The President and First Lady to Lee Greenwood&rsquo;s &lsquo;Proud to Be an American,&rdquo; as Trump waved a red baseball cap to the crowd. Melania Trump delivered her most extensive remarks in public since the day her husband was sworn-in, leading the crowd in the Lord&rsquo;s Prayer and making an appeal &ldquo;greater civility and unity&rdquo; across the political divide. But even she had harsh words for the press, telling her husband&rsquo;s supporters. &ldquo;I will always be truthful to myself and truthful to you, no matter what the opposition is saying about me.&#8221; There was little doubt that Trump enjoyed the adoration of his supporters, as he flashed thumbs-up signs and signed autographs before returning to Air Force One for the flight back to his weekend getaway. Trump views rallies like Saturday&rsquo;s as part of the job of the president, an aide said, promoting the &ldquo;spirit&rdquo; of the American people. On Friday, a spokeswoman referred to the event as a &ldquo;a campaign rally for America,&rdquo; while a White House official said Trump expects to hold more rallies outside of Washington in the upcoming weeks."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe most unconventional president in generations kicked off his 2020 re-election campaign Saturday in Florida, railing against the &ldquo;fake news&rdquo; media and promising to take his message directly to the American people. Weeks after his top aide coined the term &ldquo;alternative facts,&rdquo; Trump delivered what amounted to an alternative news report to the American people.&hellip;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":74229987,"featured_media":4676019,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[10924764,189091,1657,7053],"time_section":[204777755],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937769],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4676011"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4676011"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4676011"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4676011\u002Fauthors"}],
