","credit":"Kevin Lamarque—Reuters","title":"U.S. President Donald Trump applauds his crowd as he holds a \"Make America Great Again\" rally at Orlando Melbourne International Airport in Melbourne, Florida"},"video":{"id":"5329079548001","markup":"\u003Cdiv class=\"video-container\"\u003E\u003Cvideo id=\"brightcove-player-5329079548001\" data-video-id=\"5329079548001\" data-account=\"293884104\" data-player=\"SJa0Thl7\" data-embed=\"default\" controls preload=\"auto\" class=\"video-js responsive-video\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fvideo\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E","provider":"brightcove"},"structured":[{"tag":"video","attributes":{"controls":"1","videoid":"5329079548001"},"content":[]}]}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"term_id":10924764,"name":"2020 Election","slug":"2020-election","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":66657,"taxonomy":"post_tag","description":"","parent":0,"count":6,"filter":"raw"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"term_id":204777755,"name":"Politics","slug":"politics","term_group":0,"term_taxonomy_id":17,"taxonomy":"time_section","description":"Political insight from the Beltway and beyond. Covering the White House, elections, primaries, Congress, domestic policy, foreign policy, the military and more","parent":0,"count":11779,"filter":"raw","all_sections":["politics"]}],"fortune:primary_topic":[{}]}},{"id":4661763,"date":"2017-02-16T09:00:43","date_gmt":"2017-02-16T14:00:43","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?p=4661763"},"modified":"2017-02-16T09:00:00","modified_gmt":"2017-02-16T14:00:00","slug":"mar-a-lago-donald-trump-marjorie-post","type":"post","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4661763\u002Fmar-a-lago-donald-trump-marjorie-post\u002F","title":{"rendered":"The Mar-a-Lago Club Was a ‘Winter White House’ Even Before President Trump Got There"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EAs Zeke J. Miller \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4672984\u002Fdonald-trump-mar-a-lago\u002F\"\u003Eexplores in a feature in this week&#8217;s issue of TIME\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, the story of President Trump&#8217;s &#8220;Winter White House&#8221; at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Fla., is a complicated one. But while Trump&#8217;s use of the club may present new challenges, the current President isn&#8217;t the first to see the exclusive enclave as a fitting retreat from Washington, D.C.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt was almost exactly 90 years ago, in early 1927, that the cereal heiress and philanthropist Marjorie Merriweather Post and her second husband Edward Hutton celebrated the completion of their new estate in Palm Beach. They named the place after its waterside location: Mar-a-Lago.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;Marjorie said she was going to build a little cottage by the sea,&#8221; Hutton was often \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fbooks.google.com\u002Fbooks?id=ja3b_V1yVv0C&amp;printsec=frontcover&amp;dq=mar-a-lago+and+8+million+and+1927&amp;hl=en&amp;sa=X&amp;ved=0ahUKEwiRp42ytpDSAhWH0iYKHQw3CcUQ6AEIJDAC#v=snippet&amp;q=mar-a-lago&amp;f=false\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eheard\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to remark. &#8220;Look what we got!&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAs TIME \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1967-02-03\u002Fpage\u002F54\u002F\"\u003Eexplained\u003C\u002Fa\u003E 40 years later, as Post remained one of the most important and most respected figures in the social scenes of several cities, she had turned the &#8220;115-room Spanish &#8216;cottage&#8217; in Palm Beach&#8221; into a place known for &#8220;exquisite&#8221; hospitality, which was given an additional sheen of importance when John F. Kennedy&mdash;whose family had long wintered in Palm Beach&mdash;spent a few Christmas vacations in the area during his presidency. (The exact number of rooms has changed over time.) The place \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fcdn.loc.gov\u002Fservice\u002Fll\u002Ffedreg\u002Ffr034\u002Ffr034016\u002Ffr034016.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ebecame\u003C\u002Fa\u003E a National Historic Site in 1969.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fnewsletter\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EGet your history fix in one place: sign up for the weekly TIME History newsletter\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EPost was \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1973-09-24\u002Fpage\u002F30\u002F\"\u003Efamous\u003C\u002Fa\u003E for treating guests well, offering a full day&#8217;s worth of activities, brand new movies screened every night and, on one occasion, a special show from Ringling Bros. and Barnum &amp; Bailey circus. And so, given her wide experience as host and guest, it is perhaps unsurprising that she \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1972\u002F10\u002F22\u002Farchives\u002Fa-palm-beach-guest-house-for-presidents-and-kings.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ecame to feel\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that it was a shame that the United States did not have an appropriate place to lodge visiting dignitaries outside Washington, D.C., or for Presidents to relax during the winter.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EShe decided that, upon her death, Mar-a-Lago would become the perfect solution to that problem.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn 1972, after she agreed to include a fund for the upkeep of the place, that plan became official, as TIME \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1972-11-13\u002Fpage\u002F30\u002F\"\u003Ereported\u003C\u002Fa\u003E when Post&#8217;s decision to donate the place to the U.S. government got Congressional \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.gpo.gov\u002Ffdsys\u002Fpkg\u002FSTATUTE-86\u002Fpdf\u002FSTATUTE-86-Pg1049.pdf\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eapproval\u003C\u002Fa\u003E:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cblockquote\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"page\" title=\"Page 3\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"section\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"layoutArea\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"column\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAmerican presidential retreats have always expressed something of the personal style of the man in the White House &mdash; Richard Nixon&#8217;s Key Biscayne and San Clemente, Lyndon Johnson&#8217;s ranch. In years to come, the presidential style of leisure may be considerably grander. Last week Nixon signed a bill accepting an official new winter hideaway for the Presidents. It is Cereal Heiress Marjorie Merriweather Post&#8217;s 110-room, $7,000,000 Mar-A-Lago, in Palm Beach, a kind of Moorish Xanadu built on 17 acres of hard coral between the Atlantic ocean front and Lake Worth.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EMrs. Post, 85, has provided that the place be turned over to the Government at her death, along with a $200,000 per-annum trust fund for upkeep. Mar-A-Lago is a treasure of colonnades and turrets, built of stone from Italy, 36,000 tiles made in 15th century Spain, frescoes copied from the Medici Palace in Florence, silk needlework panels from the Venetian Doge&#8217;s palace. Suites are done in Louis XVI style or in Spanish or Early American. Outside are a nine-hole golf course and archipelagoes of reflecting pools and fountains.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThough there was no question that the gift was a large one, the magazine noted that it &#8220;seems designed to make the isolation of the presidency a bit more splendid than it ought to be&#8221; and suggested that, if he were going to spend time at Mar-a-Lago, a President ought perhaps to also spend &#8220;at least a few weekends a year in a trailer camp or a slum, or sleeping on a relative&#8217;s Hide-a-Bed in East Lansing.&#8221; (One reader \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1972-12-04\u002Fpage\u002F8\u002F\"\u003Eresponded\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to the article to propose that it should go vice versa too: every American who lives &#8220;in a slum or a trailer park or sleeps in relatives&#8217; Hide-a-Beds during the year&#8221; should be entitled to a weekend spent there in the lap of luxury.)\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"galleryContainer galleryContainer--embedded\" data-gallery=\"4669323\" data-size=\"default\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EWhen Post died the following year, the provision kicked in.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThough Richard Nixon \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1974\u002F07\u002F08\u002Farchives\u002Fnixon-inspects-palm-beach-estate-willed-to-us.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Epaid a surprise visit\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to check it out, before long it was clear that, without Post, Mar-a-Lago had gone from being the jewel of Palm Beach society&mdash;home to \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1973-09-24\u002Fpage\u002F30\u002F\"\u003E10,000 potted plants\u003C\u002Fa\u003E&mdash;to a veritable white elephant. Few officials had made use of the presidential retreat, as its grounds fell into disrepair. Despite the additional annual $100,000 put forward by Congress \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1980-08-18\u002Fpage\u002F71\u002F\"\u003Estarting\u003C\u002Fa\u003E in 1980 and the funds provided by Post&#8217;s will, maintaining the place was an enormous onus that the federal government could ill afford, and \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1981-03-09\u002Fpage\u002F63\u002F\"\u003Eeventually\u003C\u002Fa\u003E the 1972 order was \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.gpo.gov\u002Ffdsys\u002Fpkg\u002FUSCODE-2011-title16\u002Fhtml\u002FUSCODE-2011-title16-chap1A-subchapI-sec467a.htm\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Erepealed\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and the estate was deeded back to the Post Foundation.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESubsequently, in 1986, the Foundation \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1986\u002F01\u002F02\u002Fus\u002Fpost-foundation-sells-its-mansion-to-trump.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Esold\u003C\u002Fa\u003E the property to Donald Trump.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBy 1990, however,\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1990-06-18\u002Fpage\u002F68\u002F\"\u003E in dire personal financial straits\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, Trump was reported to be offering the place in the neighborhood of $30 million. It didn&#8217;t sell, and a subsequent plan to divide the estate into smaller parcels was \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1991-06-03\u002Fpage\u002F19\u002F\"\u003Eresisted\u003C\u002Fa\u003E by town officials, leading to a dust-up after Trump \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1991\u002F05\u002F26\u002Fnyregion\u002Funification-church-insists-trump-apologize.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Emade an unfounded claim\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that the Unification Church of America would buy the property if he couldn&#8217;t split it up. Finally, in 1993 he was granted \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1993\u002F06\u002F05\u002Fstyle\u002Fchronicle-902893.html\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Eapproval\u003C\u002Fa\u003E to turn the home into a private club, which it remains to this day.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn 1999, when he made news for forming a presidential exploratory committee &mdash; the first step toward running for President &mdash; he found that owning Mar-a-Lago wasn&#8217;t such a burden anymore.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;He boasts that he already owns the southern White House, which means he won&#8217;t be mooching off rich friends on Martha&#8217;s Vineyard,&#8221; TIME&#8217;s Margaret Carlson \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1999-10-18\u002Fpage\u002F74\u002F\"\u003Ereported\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, when he explained that he knew that Mar-a-Lago had been &#8220;willed to the government to be used by Presidents.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["As Zeke J. Miller ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4672984\u002Fdonald-trump-mar-a-lago\u002F"},"content":["explores in a feature in this week's issue of TIME"]},", the story of President Trump's \"Winter White House\" at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Fla., is a complicated one. But while Trump's use of the club may present new challenges, the current President isn't the first to see the exclusive enclave as a fitting retreat from Washington, D.C."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["It was almost exactly 90 years ago, in early 1927, that the cereal heiress and philanthropist Marjorie Merriweather Post and her second husband Edward Hutton celebrated the completion of their new estate in Palm Beach. They named the place after its waterside location: Mar-a-Lago."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"Marjorie said she was going to build a little cottage by the sea,\" Hutton was often ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fbooks.google.com\u002Fbooks?id=ja3b_V1yVv0C&amp;printsec=frontcover&amp;dq=mar-a-lago+and+8+million+and+1927&amp;hl=en&amp;sa=X&amp;ved=0ahUKEwiRp42ytpDSAhWH0iYKHQw3CcUQ6AEIJDAC#v=snippet&amp;q=mar-a-lago&amp;f=false"},"content":["heard"]}," to remark. \"Look what we got!\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["As TIME ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1967-02-03\u002Fpage\u002F54\u002F"},"content":["explained"]}," 40 years later, as Post remained one of the most important and most respected figures in the social scenes of several cities, she had turned the \"115-room Spanish 'cottage' in Palm Beach\" into a place known for \"exquisite\" hospitality, which was given an additional sheen of importance when John F. Kennedy—whose family had long wintered in Palm Beach—spent a few Christmas vacations in the area during his presidency. (The exact number of rooms has changed over time.) The place ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fcdn.loc.gov\u002Fservice\u002Fll\u002Ffedreg\u002Ffr034\u002Ffr034016\u002Ffr034016.pdf"},"content":["became"]}," a National Historic Site in 1969."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fnewsletter"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Get your history fix in one place: sign up for the weekly TIME History newsletter"]}]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Post was ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1973-09-24\u002Fpage\u002F30\u002F"},"content":["famous"]}," for treating guests well, offering a full day's worth of activities, brand new movies screened every night and, on one occasion, a special show from Ringling Bros. and Barnum &amp; Bailey circus. And so, given her wide experience as host and guest, it is perhaps unsurprising that she ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1972\u002F10\u002F22\u002Farchives\u002Fa-palm-beach-guest-house-for-presidents-and-kings.html"},"content":["came to feel"]}," that it was a shame that the United States did not have an appropriate place to lodge visiting dignitaries outside Washington, D.C., or for Presidents to relax during the winter."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["She decided that, upon her death, Mar-a-Lago would become the perfect solution to that problem."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["In 1972, after she agreed to include a fund for the upkeep of the place, that plan became official, as TIME ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1972-11-13\u002Fpage\u002F30\u002F"},"content":["reported"]}," when Post's decision to donate the place to the U.S. government got Congressional ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.gpo.gov\u002Ffdsys\u002Fpkg\u002FSTATUTE-86\u002Fpdf\u002FSTATUTE-86-Pg1049.pdf"},"content":["approval"]},":"]},{"tag":"blockquote","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["American presidential retreats have always expressed something of the personal style of the man in the White House — Richard Nixon's Key Biscayne and San Clemente, Lyndon Johnson's ranch. In years to come, the presidential style of leisure may be considerably grander. Last week Nixon signed a bill accepting an official new winter hideaway for the Presidents. It is Cereal Heiress Marjorie Merriweather Post's 110-room, $7,000,000 Mar-A-Lago, in Palm Beach, a kind of Moorish Xanadu built on 17 acres of hard coral between the Atlantic ocean front and Lake Worth."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Mrs. Post, 85, has provided that the place be turned over to the Government at her death, along with a $200,000 per-annum trust fund for upkeep. Mar-A-Lago is a treasure of colonnades and turrets, built of stone from Italy, 36,000 tiles made in 15th century Spain, frescoes copied from the Medici Palace in Florence, silk needlework panels from the Venetian Doge's palace. Suites are done in Louis XVI style or in Spanish or Early American. Outside are a nine-hole golf course and archipelagoes of reflecting pools and fountains."]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Though there was no question that the gift was a large one, the magazine noted that it \"seems designed to make the isolation of the presidency a bit more splendid than it ought to be\" and suggested that, if he were going to spend time at Mar-a-Lago, a President ought perhaps to also spend \"at least a few weekends a year in a trailer camp or a slum, or sleeping on a relative's Hide-a-Bed in East Lansing.\" (One reader It didn't sell, and a subsequent plan to divide the estate into smaller parcels was ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1991-06-03\u002Fpage\u002F19\u002F"},"content":["resisted"]}," by town officials, leading to a dust-up after Trump ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1991\u002F05\u002F26\u002Fnyregion\u002Funification-church-insists-trump-apologize.html"},"content":["made an unfounded claim"]}," that the Unification Church of America would buy the property if he couldn't split it up. Finally, in 1993 he was granted ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.nytimes.com\u002F1993\u002F06\u002F05\u002Fstyle\u002Fchronicle-902893.html"},"content":["approval"]}," to turn the home into a private club, which it remains to this day."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["In 1999, when he made news for forming a presidential exploratory committee — the first step toward running for President — he found that owning Mar-a-Lago wasn't such a burden anymore."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"He boasts that he already owns the southern White House, which means he won't be mooching off rich friends on Martha's Vineyard,\" TIME's Margaret Carlson ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fvault\u002Fissue\u002F1999-10-18\u002Fpage\u002F74\u002F"},"content":["reported"]},", when he explained that he knew that Mar-a-Lago had been \"willed to the government to be used by Presidents.\""]}],"plain":"As Zeke J. Miller explores in a feature in this week&#8217;s issue of TIME, the story of President Trump&#8217;s &#8220;Winter White House&#8221; at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach, Fla., is a complicated one. But while Trump&#8217;s use of the club may present new challenges, the current President isn&#8217;t the first to see the exclusive enclave as a fitting retreat from Washington, D.C. It was almost exactly 90 years ago, in early 1927, that the cereal heiress and philanthropist Marjorie Merriweather Post and her second husband Edward Hutton celebrated the completion of their new estate in Palm Beach. They named the place after its waterside location: Mar-a-Lago. &#8220;Marjorie said she was going to build a little cottage by the sea,&#8221; Hutton was often heard to remark. &#8220;Look what we got!&#8221; As TIME explained 40 years later, as Post remained one of the most important and most respected figures in the social scenes of several cities, she had turned the &#8220;115-room Spanish &#8216;cottage&#8217; in Palm Beach&#8221; into a place known for &#8220;exquisite&#8221; hospitality, which was given an additional sheen of importance when John F. Kennedy&mdash;whose family had long wintered in Palm Beach&mdash;spent a few Christmas vacations in the area during his presidency. (The exact number of rooms has changed over time.) The place became a National Historic Site in 1969. Get your history fix in one place: sign up for the weekly TIME History newsletter Post was famous for treating guests well, offering a full day&#8217;s worth of activities, brand new movies screened every night and, on one occasion, a special show from Ringling Bros. and Barnum &amp; Bailey circus. And so, given her wide experience as host and guest, it is perhaps unsurprising that she came to feel that it was a shame that the United States did not have an appropriate place to lodge visiting dignitaries outside Washington, D.C., or for Presidents to relax during the winter. She decided that, upon her death, Mar-a-Lago would become the perfect solution to that problem. In 1972, after she agreed to include a fund for the upkeep of the place, that plan became official, as TIME reported when Post&#8217;s decision to donate the place to the U.S. government got Congressional approval: American presidential retreats have always expressed something of the personal style of the man in the White House &mdash; Richard Nixon&#8217;s Key Biscayne and San Clemente, Lyndon Johnson&#8217;s ranch. In years to come, the presidential style of leisure may be considerably grander. Last week Nixon signed a bill accepting an official new winter hideaway for the Presidents. It is Cereal Heiress Marjorie Merriweather Post&#8217;s 110-room, $7,000,000 Mar-A-Lago, in Palm Beach, a kind of Moorish Xanadu built on 17 acres of hard coral between the Atlantic ocean front and Lake Worth. Mrs. Post, 85, has provided that the place be turned over to the Government at her death, along with a $200,000 per-annum trust fund for upkeep. Mar-A-Lago is a treasure of colonnades and turrets, built of stone from Italy, 36,000 tiles made in 15th century Spain, frescoes copied from the Medici Palace in Florence, silk needlework panels from the Venetian Doge&#8217;s palace. Suites are done in Louis XVI style or in Spanish or Early American. Outside are a nine-hole golf course and archipelagoes of reflecting pools and fountains. Though there was no question that the gift was a large one, the magazine noted that it &#8220;seems designed to make the isolation of the presidency a bit more splendid than it ought to be&#8221; and suggested that, if he were going to spend time at Mar-a-Lago, a President ought perhaps to also spend &#8220;at least a few weekends a year in a trailer camp or a slum, or sleeping on a relative&#8217;s Hide-a-Bed in East Lansing.&#8221; (One reader responded to the article to propose that it should go vice versa too: every American who lives &#8220;in a slum or a trailer park or sleeps in relatives&#8217; Hide-a-Beds during the year&#8221; should be entitled to a weekend spent there in the lap of luxury.) When Post died the following year, the provision kicked in. Though Richard Nixon paid a surprise visit to check it out, before long it was clear that, without Post, Mar-a-Lago had gone from being the jewel of Palm Beach society&mdash;home to 10,000 potted plants&mdash;to a veritable white elephant. Few officials had made use of the presidential retreat, as its grounds fell into disrepair. Despite the additional annual $100,000 put forward by Congress starting in 1980 and the funds provided by Post&#8217;s will, maintaining the place was an enormous onus that the federal government could ill afford, and eventually the 1972 order was repealed and the estate was deeded back to the Post Foundation. Subsequently, in 1986, the Foundation sold the property to Donald Trump. By 1990, however, in dire personal financial straits, Trump was reported to be offering the place in the neighborhood of $30 million. It didn&#8217;t sell, and a subsequent plan to divide the estate into smaller parcels was resisted by town officials, leading to a dust-up after Trump made an unfounded claim that the Unification Church of America would buy the property if he couldn&#8217;t split it up. Finally, in 1993 he was granted approval to turn the home into a private club, which it remains to this day. In 1999, when he made news for forming a presidential exploratory committee &mdash; the first step toward running for President &mdash; he found that owning Mar-a-Lago wasn&#8217;t such a burden anymore. &#8220;He boasts that he already owns the southern White House, which means he won&#8217;t be mooching off rich friends on Martha&#8217;s Vineyard,&#8221; TIME&#8217;s Margaret Carlson reported, when he explained that he knew that Mar-a-Lago had been &#8220;willed to the government to be used by Presidents.&#8221;"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe estate, now a club owned by President Trump, was a flop as an official presidential retreat\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":31116903,"featured_media":4663242,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[189091,1657,8245335,660,398,3225],"time_section":[262754262,204777755],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937773],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4661763"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4661763"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4661763"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4661763\u002Fau Thirty-two-year-old Joseph Schneider pleaded no contest to second-degree arson during Monday&#8217;s hearing in Fort Pierce. A no contest plea is treated the same as a guilty plea. Prosecutor Steve Gosnell says Schreiber confessed to detectives that he set the fire, saying he believed Muslims &#8220;are trying to infiltrate our government&#8221; and that &#8220;the teaching of Islam should be completely, completely illegal.&#8221; Schneider read a written statement where he said the fire was not cause by hate but by his anxiety. Schreiber set the fire at the Islamic Center of Fort Pierce last Sept. 11, the 15th anniversary of the 2001 terrorist attacks. No one was injured in the fire. Pulse nightclub shooter Omar Mateen sometimes attended the mosque. Last July, Schreiber, who is Jewish, posted on Facebook that &#8220;All Islam is radical&#8221; and that all Muslims should be treated as terrorists and criminals."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EJoseph Schneider pleaded no contest to second-degree A federal judge has ordered a Florida golf course owned by President Donald Trump to pay $5.7 million to 65 former members who had been denied membership refunds after he bought the club in 2012.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDistrict Judge Kenneth Marra ruled Wednesday that Trump National Golf Club in Jupiter violated contracts the members had signed with the previous owner, Ritz-Carlton.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe 65 were on a resignation waiting list when Trump bought the club. District Judge Kenneth Marra ruled Wednesday that Trump National Golf Club in Jupiter violated contracts the members had signed with the previous owner, Ritz-Carlton. The 65 were on a resignation waiting list when Trump bought the club. Under their contracts, they had to wait until a replacement member was found. They would then receive their membership deposits back. Until then, they were still obligated to pay dues but had access to the club. Trump demanded they still pay dues but denied them access. His organization released a statement saying it disagrees with the ruling and plans to appeal."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe club must pay back 65 members who were denied It was not immediately clear whether he has an attorney."]}],"plain":"Police say a Florida sheriff&#8217;s deputy attempted to kill a woman whom he had been defrauding and whose dog he stole and sold on Craigslist. Deputy Frankie Bybee, 46, was accused of defrauding a 79-year-old woman living in Sarasota after befriending her following a service call in October, Sarasota County Sheriff Tom Knight told reporters on Monday. The deputy, who had worked with the department for 18 years, was put on administrative leave earlier in January after his fingerprint was discovered on checks totaling $65,000, which the woman said were fraudulently signed, the Associated Press reported. After the woman alerted police about the defrauding, Bybee allegedly tried to kill her by forcing her to take pills, CBS News affiliate WTSP reported. He then tried to make her death look like a suicide. Knight said the woman also gave Bybee her dog to look after while she was in the hospital, but that he sold it on Craigslist. Media gathering for press conference arrest of Frankie Eugene Bybee, 18yr employee of @SarasotaSheriff #wtsp pic.twitter.com\u002FgiDdmuilL7 &mdash; Isabel Mascarenas (@IMascarenas) January 23, 2017 Bybee was held without bail on attempted murder and other charges. It was not immediately clear whether he has an attorney. &nbsp;"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EHe&#8217;s also accused of defrauding Panic erupted about 3:40 p.m. when shots were fired at Martin Luther King Jr. Memorial Park, the Miami-Dade Police Department said in a news release. The victims included the 11-year-old, five teenage girls and two men, ages 20 and 30. All suffered apparent gunshot wounds. Their conditions were not immediately known. It&rsquo;s also unclear what prompted the shooting. Police said two people have been detained &ldquo;for questioning to determine their involvement, if any.&rdquo; Celebrants gathered at the park for a family festival following the city&rsquo;s annual parade to pay tribute to the civil rights icon, according to CNN. Stolen From Hospital 18 Years Ago Found Safe"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EA Florida newborn taken from her family in the hospital more than 18 years ago has been located living with her alleged abductor, who she believed to be her mom, law enforcement announced Friday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EKamiyah Mobley was only hours old when authorities say a woman posing as a health care worker took her from a Jacksonville, Florida, hospital in July 1998. According to local reports, Kamiyah was briefly given to the woman because her family believed the woman was a nurse, while hospital staff believed the woman was a relative.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOn Friday, Jacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said at a news conference that Kamiyah had been found in Walterboro, South Carolina, living under a false identity apparently created for her following her abduction.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe said Kamiyah&rsquo;s biological parents were overjoyed at the news of her discovery: Her mother was &ldquo;elated.&rdquo; He noted that Kamiyah has not been reunited with her parents yet and said any decision about such a reunion was solely up to her as an adult.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe woman who Kamiyah believed to be her mother, Gloria \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fwilliams-364\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EWilliams\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, was arrested Friday and charged with first-degree kidnapping and third-degree interference with custody, prosecutors said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EGloria Williams was arrested at her home in Walterboro, Sheriff Williams said. Kamiyah was not present.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article-body\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"article-body__inner\"\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EKamiyah&rsquo;s disappearance in 1998 made national news and continued to garner attention as it turned cold over the years, becoming the rarest of rare things: a child&rsquo;s hospital abduction that was never solved.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThat changed this week, when on Thursday night authorities confirmed Kamiyah&rsquo;s identity after they were led to her by a series of leads beginning late last year, Sheriff Williams said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe said Kamiyah has had &ldquo;some inclination&rdquo; beginning several months ago that she may be involved in the case but otherwise &ldquo;appears to be a normal 18-year-old young woman.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESheriff Williams declined to identify Kamiyah by the identity under which she has been living for so many years, out of respect for her privacy.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;She&rsquo;s going to need time and assistance to process all of this,&rdquo; he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe stressed that many questions remain in the case and that the investigation is in its early stages. &ldquo;A case like this we have not seen in this country in a long time,&rdquo; he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIndeed, statistics show that such hospital abductions rarely resolve this way. In 2015, \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.lasvegasnow.com\u002Fnews\u002Fi-team-mans-identity-revealed-50-year-old-mystery-solved\u002F131128837\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ea Nevada man learned\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that he had actually been stolen from his birth parents in the hospital and then abandoned before being adopted.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIt was not immediately clear if Gloria Williams has entered a plea or retained an attorney or if she has been extradited from South Carolina.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cfooter class=\"article-footer\"\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"articles-recirculation articles-recirculation--see-also channel__color--border-color\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EThis \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fpeople.com\u002Fcrime\u002Fmissing-kamiyah-mobley-found\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Earticle\u003C\u002Fa\u003E originally appeared on \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.people.com\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EPeople.com\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Ffooter\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["A Florida newborn taken from her family in the hospital more than 18 years ago has been located living with her alleged abductor, who she believed to be her mom, law enforcement announced Friday."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Kamiyah Mobley was only hours old when authorities say a woman posing as a health care worker took her from a Jacksonville, Florida, hospital in July 1998. According to local reports, Kamiyah was briefly given to the woman because her family believed the woman was a nurse, while hospital staff believed the woman was a relative."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["On Friday, Jacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said at a news conference that Kamiyah had been found in Walterboro, South Carolina, living under a false identity apparently created for her following her abduction."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["He said Kamiyah’s biological parents were overjoyed at the news of her discovery: Her mother was “elated.” He noted that Kamiyah has not been reunited with her parents yet and said any decision about such a reunion was solely up to her as an adult."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The woman who Kamiyah believed to be her mother, Gloria ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fwilliams-364\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Williams"]},", was arrested Friday and charged with first-degree kidnapping and third-degree interference with custody, prosecutors said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Gloria Williams was arrested at her home in Walterboro, Sheriff Williams said. Kamiyah was not present."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Kamiyah’s disappearance in 1998 made national news and continued to garner attention as it turned cold over the years, becoming the rarest of rare things: a child’s hospital abduction that was never solved."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["That changed this week, when on Thursday night authorities confirmed Kamiyah’s identity after they were led to her by a series of leads beginning late last year, Sheriff Williams said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["He said Kamiyah has had “some inclination” beginning several months ago that she may be involved in the case but otherwise “appears to be a normal 18-year-old young woman.”"]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Sheriff Williams declined to identify Kamiyah by the identity under which she has been living for so many years, out of respect for her privacy."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["“She’s going to need time and assistance to process all of this,” he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["He stressed that many questions remain in the case and that the investigation is in its early stages. “A case like this we have not seen in this country in a long time,” he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Indeed, statistics show that such hospital abductions rarely resolve this way. In 2015, ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.lasvegasnow.com\u002Fnews\u002Fi-team-mans-identity-revealed-50-year-old-mystery-solved\u002F131128837","target":"_blank"},"content":["a Nevada man learned"]}," that he had actually been stolen from his birth parents in the hospital and then abandoned before being adopted."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["It was not immediately clear if Gloria Williams has entered a plea or retained an attorney or if she has been extradited from South Carolina."]},{"tag":"footer","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["This ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fpeople.com\u002Fcrime\u002Fmissing-kamiyah-mobley-found\u002F"},"content":["article"]}," originally appeared on ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.people.com"},"content":["People.com"]}]}]}]}],"plain":"A Florida newborn taken from her family in the hospital more than 18 years ago has been located living with her alleged abductor, who she believed to be her mom, law enforcement announced Friday. Kamiyah Mobley was only hours old when authorities say a woman posing as a health care worker took her from a Jacksonville, Florida, hospital in July 1998. According to local reports, Kamiyah was briefly given to the woman because her family believed the woman was a nurse, while hospital staff believed the woman was a relative. On Friday, Jacksonville Sheriff Mike Williams said at a news conference that Kamiyah had been found in Walterboro, South Carolina, living under a false identity apparently created for her following her abduction. He said Kamiyah&rsquo;s biological parents were overjoyed at the news of her discovery: Her mother was &ldquo;elated.&rdquo; He noted that Kamiyah has not been reunited with her parents yet and said any decision about such a reunion was solely up to her as an adult. The woman who Kamiyah believed to be her mother, Gloria Williams, was arrested Friday and charged with first-degree kidnapping and third-degree interference with custody, prosecutors said. Gloria Williams was arrested at her home in Walterboro, Sheriff Williams said. Kamiyah was not present. Kamiyah&rsquo;s disappearance in 1998 made national news and continued to garner attention as it turned cold over the years, becoming the rarest of rare things: a child&rsquo;s hospital abduction that was never solved. That changed this week, when on Thursday night authorities confirmed Kamiyah&rsquo;s identity after they were led to her by a series of leads beginning late last year, Sheriff Williams said. He said Kamiyah has had &ldquo;some inclination&rdquo; beginning several months ago that she may be involved in the case but otherwise &ldquo;appears to be a normal 18-year-old young woman.&rdquo; Sheriff Williams declined to identify Kamiyah by the identity under which she has been living for so many years, out of respect for her privacy. &ldquo;She&rsquo;s going to need time and assistance to process all of this,&rdquo; he said. He stressed that many questions remain in the case and that the investigation is in its early stages. &ldquo;A case like this we have not seen in this country in a long time,&rdquo; he said. Indeed, statistics show that such hospital abductions rarely resolve this way. In 2015, a Nevada man learned that he had actually been stolen from his birth parents in the hospital and then abandoned before being adopted. It was not immediately clear if Gloria Williams has entered a plea or retained an attorney or if she has been extradited from South Carolina. This article originally appeared on People.com"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EKamiyah Mobley grew up believing her alleged abductor was her mother\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":99245892,"featured_media":4635026,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[3898,1657,430939235],"time_section":[204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937772],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4634998"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4634998"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4634998"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4634998\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune:newsle ey_article?categories=1"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\u002F\u002Fapi.w.org\u002F{rel}","templated":true}]}}],[{"id":3898,"link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Ftag\u002Fcrime\u002F","name":"Crime","slug":"crime","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags\u002F3898"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags"}],"about":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Ftaxonomies\u002Fpost_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fposts?tags=3898"},{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fmoney_article?tags=3898"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\u002F\u002Fapi.w.org\u002F{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":1657,"link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Ftag\u002Fflorida\u002F","name":"Florida","slug":"florida","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags\u002F1657"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags"}],"about":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Ftaxonomies\u002Fpost_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fposts?tags=1657"},{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fmoney_article?tags=1657"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\u002F\u002Fapi.w.org\u002F{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":430939235,"link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Ftag\u002Fonetime\u002F","name":"onetime","slug":"onetime","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags\u002F430939235"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags"}],"about":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Ft target=\"_blank\"\u003Ebid farewell\u003C\u002Fa\u003E as president, but he has a few official &mdash; and unofficial &mdash; duties as leader of the free world to finish up first.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EOn Saturday, President Obama served as a groomsman at his personal aide and golf partner, White House trip director Marvin Nicholson&#8217;s, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fwww.theknot.com\u002Fus\u002Fhelen-pajcic-and-marvin-nicholson-jan-2017\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ewedding\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, The Washington target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ereports\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Nicholson and his wife Helen Pajcic, who works on policy at at the Department of Education, tied the knot at a private home in Jacksonville, Fla.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EJust as President Obama stood by Nicholson&#8217;s side on his wedding day, Nicholson has been there for Obama throughout his tenure. The \u003Cem\u003EPost\u003C\u002Fem\u003E reports that Nicholson helped plan trips for the president and often kept him company by playing golf or cards during flights.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFirst Lady \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626173\u002Fmichelle-obama-hope-final-first-lady-remarks\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EMichelle Obama\u003C\u002Fa\u003E didn&#8217;t make the trip down to Florida. On Saturday, President Obama served as a groomsman at his personal aide and golf partner, White House trip director Marvin Nicholson&#8217;s, wedding, The Washington Post reports. Nicholson and his wife Helen Pajcic, who works on policy at at the Department of Education, tied the knot at a private home in Jacksonville, Fla. Just as President Obama stood by Nicholson&#8217;s side on his wedding day, Nicholson has been there for Obama throughout his tenure. The Post reports that Nicholson helped plan trips for the president and often kept him company by playing golf or cards during flights. First Lady Michelle Obama didn&#8217;t make the trip down to Florida. The president was instead flanked by Secret Service guards who also kept in line with the black-tie attire requirements and wore tuxedoes. See below. [Washington Post, The Cut]"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EHe was in November that concerned FBI agents, who referred him for mental health treatment.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EEsteban Santiago, 26, pulled a semiautomatic handgun from his checked luggage Friday \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626500\u002Ffort-lauderdale-airport-attack-target\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ein the baggage claim area\u003C\u002Fa\u003E of Terminal 2 and began firing at travelers until he ran out of ammunition, threw his gun down and laid spread-eagle on the ground, the Associated Press reported.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt a press conference Saturday morning, FBI agent George Piro, who is in charge of the Miami field office leading the investigation, confirmed reports that Santiago had visited the FBI field office in Anchorage, Alaska in November.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;He walked in, as anyone has the right to do so,&#8221; Piro said. &#8220;It was during that contact that the agents, themselves, noted the erratic behavior that concerned them.&#8221; Piro said Santiago was taken into custody at that time and referred to a facility for mental health treatment.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ESantiago arrived Friday in Fort Lauderdale aboard a \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fdelta-air-lines-68\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EDelta\u003C\u002Fa\u003E flight from Anchorage, where the only piece of luggage he checked was his gun, Anchorage airport police chief Jesse Davis told the AP.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;The indication is that he came here to carry out this horrific attack. We have not identified any triggers that would have caused this attack,&#8221; Piro said Saturday, adding that there has been no indication of a specific reason why Santiago&mdash;who authorities say acted alone&mdash;chose the Fort Lauderdale airport. Piro said investigators are continuing to explore terrorism as a potential motive.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIn addition to the five who were killed, six people were injured in the shooting, Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel said at Saturday&#8217;s press conference, correcting an initial statement from authorities that had said eight were wounded. He said three are in good condition and three remain in intensive care."]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"controls":"1","videoid":"5273246938001"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The incident sparked panic among Fort Lauderdale travelers, many of whom fled onto the tarmac to evacuate. An additional 37 people were later taken to hospitals with minor injuries resulting from the panic, including chest pain, anxiety and fall injuries."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Family members said Santiago—who was living in Anchorage—was a new father with a history of mental health problems, the AP reported. He served in Iraq for a year with the National Guard after being deployed in 2010."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["A military spokeswoman told the AP that Santiago was discharged from the Alaska Army National Guard last year for unsatisfactory performance. The Pentagon said Santiago went AWOL multiple times and was demoted and then discharged, the AP reported."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Bryan Santiago told the AP that his brother hadn't spoken to him about medical issues, but Esteban Santiago's girlfriend had recently told his family he was receiving psychological treatment."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"We have not talked for the past three weeks,\" his brother told the AP. \"That's a bit unusual ... I'm in shock. He was a serious person ... He was a normal person.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The incident is still being investigated by the FBI, and Santiago is expected to appear in federal court on Monday."]}],"plain":"The man who killed five people in a shooting Friday at Florida&rsquo;s Fort Lauderdale&ndash;Hollywood International Airport demonstrated &#8220;erratic behavior&#8221; in November that concerned FBI agents, who referred him for mental health treatment. Esteban Santiago, 26, pulled a semiautomatic handgun from his checked luggage Friday in the baggage claim area of Terminal 2 and began firing at travelers until he ran out of ammunition, threw his gun down and laid spread-eagle on the ground, the Associated Press reported. At a press conference Saturday morning, FBI agent George Piro, who is in charge of the Miami field office leading the investigation, confirmed reports that Santiago had visited the FBI field office in Anchorage, Alaska in November. &#8220;He walked in, as anyone has the right to do so,&#8221; Piro said. &#8220;It was during that contact that the agents, themselves, noted the erratic behavior that concerned them.&#8221; Piro said Santiago was taken into custody at that time and referred to a facility for mental health treatment. Santiago arrived Friday in Fort Lauderdale aboard a Delta flight from Anchorage, where the only piece of luggage he checked was his gun, Anchorage airport police chief Jesse Davis told the AP. &#8220;The indication is that he came here to carry out this horrific attack. We have not identified any triggers that would have caused this attack,&#8221; Piro said Saturday, adding that there has been no indication of a specific reason why Santiago&mdash;who authorities say acted alone&mdash;chose the Fort Lauderdale airport. Piro said investigators are continuing to explore terrorism as a potential motive. In addition to the five who were killed, six people were injured in the shooting, Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel said at Saturday&#8217;s press conference, correcting an initial statement from authorities that had said eight were wounded. He said three are in good condition and three remain in intensive care. The incident sparked panic among Fort Lauderdale travelers, many of whom fled onto the tarmac to evacuate. An additional 37 people were later taken to hospitals with minor injuries resulting from the panic, including chest pain, anxiety and fall injuries. Family members said Santiago&mdash;who was living in Anchorage&mdash;was a new father with a history of mental health problems, the AP reported. He served in Iraq for a year with the National Guard after being deployed in 2010. A military spokeswoman told the AP that Santiago was discharged from the Alaska Army National Guard last year for unsatisfactory performance. The Pentagon said Santiago went AWOL multiple times and was demoted and then discharged, the AP reported. Bryan Santiago told the AP that his brother hadn&#8217;t spoken to him about medical issues, but Esteban Santiago&#8217;s girlfriend had recently told his family he was receiving psychological treatment. &#8220;We have not talked for the past three weeks,&#8221; his brother told the AP. &#8220;That&#8217;s a bit unusual &#8230; I&#8217;m in shock. He was a serious person &#8230; He was a normal person.&#8221; The incident is still being investigated by the FBI, and Santiago is expected to appear in federal court on Monday."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EEsteban Santiago was arrested for killing five people and wounding six others\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":99231085,"featured_media":4627192,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[2454,3898,1657,430939235],"time_section":[204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937772],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":true,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4627231"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4627231"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4627231"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4627231\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune:ne Lauderdale Shooting Exposes Airport Security Gaps, Experts Say"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626360\u002Ffort-lauderdale-florida-airport-shooting\u002F?xid=homepage\"\u003Eshooting\u003C\u002Fa\u003E at a Florida airport Friday afternoon exposed one of the most \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4268363\u002Fbrussels-attacks-us-airports-terrorism\u002F\"\u003Eglaring security weaknesses\u003C\u002Fa\u003E in the U.S.: areas inside airports that aren&rsquo;t subject to routine security checks.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAuthorities said a lone shooter who had carried a gun in his checked bag got off a plane at the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.broward.org\u002Fairport\u002FPages\u002FDefault.aspx\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EFort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport\u003C\u002Fa\u003E Friday afternoon and shot 13 people, killing five of them, at a baggage claim area. Hundreds of travelers fled onto the tarmac amid scenes of chaos and gridlock around the airport. Officials said the shooter was in custody and unharmed.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EShortly after the shooting, U.S. Sen. Bill Nelson \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fabcnews.go.com\u002FUS\u002FwireStory\u002Flatest-multiple-dead-wounded-airport-shooting-44604216\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ereferred to the baggage claim area as a &#8220;soft target,&#8221;\u003C\u002Fa\u003E which has been a particular concern of security experts.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;It&rsquo;s not surprising because people that plan incidents of violence&mdash;whether it&rsquo;s terrorism or other acts of violence&mdash;seek the least path of resistance,&#8221; Jeff Slotnick, president of security firm Setracon, said Friday afternoon following the shooting.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"video-container\"\u003E\u003Cvideo id=\"brightcove-player-5273246938001\" data-video-id=\"5273246938001\" data-account=\"293884104\" data-player=\"SJa0Thl7\" data-embed=\"default\" controls preload=\"auto\" class=\"video-js responsive-video\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fvideo\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe shooter&#8217;s motive was not immediately clear on Friday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4268363\u002Fbrussels-attacks-us-airports-terrorism\u002F\"\u003ERead more: Experts Say U.S. Airports Vulnerable to Brussels-Style Attack \u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe weaknesses of airport security in areas beyond TSA screening have long been a point of concern in the U.S. There have been attacks targeting similar vulnerabilities of airports overseas, including a suicide bombing in 2011 at Domodedovo Airport in Moscow, an attack on the Jinnah International Airport by the Pakistani Taliban in 2014, a terrorist attack in Brussels that killed 32 people and injured more than 300 in March 2016, and an attack in June 2016 at the Ataturk Airport in Istanbul, Turkey, that killed 45 and wounded more than 200. Until Friday, the only major terrorist incident inside an airport since Sept. 11 occurred in 2013 when a gunman fatally wounded a TSA employee at Los Angeles International Airport.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626360\u002Ffort-lauderdale-florida-airport-shooting\u002F?xid=homepage\"\u003ERead more: Five People Killed in Shooting at Fort Lauderdale Airport\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4268363\u002Fbrussels-attacks-us-airports-terrorism\u002F\"\u003ESecurity experts\u003C\u002Fa\u003E widely acknowledge that security outside the robust TSA screening for passengers has significant shortcomings. Baggage claim, drop-off zones, transportation areas and check-in counters are all essentially open to anyone and have minimal police presence. Airports could make security in those areas more robust and perhaps expand the secure area, but officials constantly must weigh the tradeoffs between security and convenience.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;At the end there is always an outer perimeter at which the security measures are never present,&#8221; says Bennet Waters, a counterterrorism expert at the Chertoff Group who served in the Department of Homeland Security. &#8220;We can continue to expand those circles, but the question becomes: where does it end?&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EStill, airport officials have made efforts to ensure security before checkpoints. Non-secure areas have cameras, roving officers and dogs in addition to security training for other airport personnel, says Slotnick. The relatively limited death toll in Friday&#8217;s incident speaks to how fast officials were able to respond, he says.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626360\u002Ffort-lauderdale-florida-airport-shooting\u002F?xid=homepage"},"content":["shooting"]}," at a Florida airport Friday afternoon exposed one of the most ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4268363\u002Fbrussels-attacks-us-airports-terrorism\u002F"},"content":["glaring security weaknesses"]}," in the U.S.: areas inside airports that aren’t subject to routine security checks."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Authorities said a lone shooter who had carried a gun in his checked bag got off a plane at the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.broward.org\u002Fairport\u002FPages\u002FDefault.aspx"},"content":["Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport"]}," Friday afternoon and shot 13 people, killing five of them, at a baggage claim area. Until Friday, the only major terrorist incident inside an airport since Sept. 11 occurred in 2013 when a gunman fatally wounded a TSA employee at Los Angeles International Airport."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626360\u002Ffort-lauderdale-florida-airport-shooting\u002F?xid=homepage"},"content":["Read more: Five People Killed in Shooting at Fort Lauderdale Airport"]}]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4268363\u002Fbrussels-attacks-us-airports-terrorism\u002F"},"content":["Security experts"]}," widely acknowledge that security outside the robust TSA screening for passengers has significant shortcomings. Baggage claim, drop-off zones, transportation areas and check-in counters are all essentially open to anyone and have minimal police presence. Airports could make security in those areas more robust and perhaps expand the secure area, but officials constantly must weigh the tradeoffs between security and convenience."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"At the end there is always an outer perimeter at which the security measures are never present,\" says Bennet Waters, a counterterrorism expert at the Chertoff Group who served in the Department of Homeland Security. \"We can continue to expand those circles, but the question becomes: where does it end?\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Still, airport officials have made efforts to ensure security before checkpoints. Non-secure areas have cameras, roving officers and dogs in addition to security training for other airport personnel, says Slotnick. The relatively limited death toll in Friday's incident speaks to how fast officials were able to respond, he says."]}],"plain":"The shooting at a Florida airport Friday afternoon exposed one of the most glaring security weaknesses in the U.S.: areas inside airports that aren&rsquo;t subject to routine security checks. Authorities said a lone shooter who had carried a gun in his checked bag got off a plane at the Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport Friday afternoon and shot 13 people, killing five of them, at a baggage claim area. Hundreds of travelers fled onto the tarmac amid scenes of chaos and gridlock around the airport. Officials said the shooter was in custody and unharmed. Shortly after the shooting, U.S. Sen. Bill Nelson referred to the baggage claim area as a &#8220;soft target,&#8221; which has been a particular concern of security experts. &#8220;It&rsquo;s not surprising because people that plan incidents of violence&mdash;whether it&rsquo;s terrorism or other acts of violence&mdash;seek the least path of resistance,&#8221; Jeff Slotnick, president of security firm Setracon, said Friday afternoon following the shooting. The shooter&#8217;s motive was not immediately clear on Friday. Read more: Experts Say U.S. Airports Vulnerable to Brussels-Style Attack The weaknesses of airport security in areas beyond TSA screening have long been a point of concern in the U.S. There have been attacks targeting similar vulnerabilities of airports overseas, including a suicide bombing in 2011 at Domodedovo Airport in Moscow, an attack on the Jinnah International Airport by the Pakistani Taliban in 2014, a terrorist attack in Brussels that killed 32 people and injured more than 300 in March 2016, and an attack in June 2016 at the Ataturk Airport in Istanbul, Turkey, that killed 45 and wounded more than 200. Until Friday, the only major terrorist incident inside an airport since Sept. 11 occurred in 2013 when a gunman fatally wounded a TSA employee at Los Angeles International Airport. Read more: Five People Killed in Shooting at Fort Lauderdale Airport Security experts widely acknowledge that security outside the robust TSA screening for passengers has significant shortcomings. Baggage claim, drop-off zones, transportation areas and check-in counters are all essentially open to anyone and have minimal police presence. Airports could make security in those areas more robust and perhaps expand the secure area, but officials constantly must weigh the tradeoffs between security and convenience. &#8220;At the end there is always an outer perimeter at which the security measures are never present,&#8221; says Bennet Waters, a counterterrorism expert at the Chertoff Group who served in the Department of Homeland Security. &#8220;We can continue to expand those circles, but the question becomes: where does it end?&#8221; Still, airport officials have made efforts to ensure security before checkpoints. Non-secure areas have cameras, roving officers and dogs in addition to security training for other airport personnel, says Slotnick. The relatively limited death toll in Friday&#8217;s incident speaks to how fast officials were able to respond, he says."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003ELittle security outside of TSA screening\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":3502846,"featured_media":4626544,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[59240,3898,1657,2300,200],"time_section":[204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937772],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":false,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4626500"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4626500"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4626500"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626500\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune details to know right now:\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EFive people were killed\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThe \u003Ca County Sheriff Scott Israel said at a press conference Saturday morning, correcting an initial statement from authorities that had said eight were wounded.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe six gunshot-wound victims were taken to local hospitals, where three are in good condition and three remain in intensive care as of Saturday morning.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe shooting took place in the baggage claim area of Terminal 2, which serves \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fdelta-air-lines-68\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EDelta Air Lines\u003C\u002Fa\u003E and Air Canada, the Associated Press reported.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe shooter pulled a gun out of his luggage and shot at travelers in the area before throwing his weapon down and lying spread-eagle on the ground, the AP reported, citing witnesses.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAn additional 37 people were later taken to area hospitals with minor injuries resulting from the panic, including chest pain, anxiety and fall injuries.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe lone suspect is in custody\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EThe Broward County Sheriff&#8217;s Office identified the gunman as \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4627231\u002Ffort-lauderdale-airport-shooting-suspect\u002F\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E26-year-old Esteban Santiago\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, who is expected to appear in federal court on Monday. He was taken into custody unharmed Friday and was questioned by law enforcement.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt a press conference Saturday morning, FBI agent George Piro said investigators are continuing to explore terrorism as a potential motive.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;The indication is that he came here to carry out this horrific attack. We have not identified any triggers that would have caused this attack,&rdquo; Piro said Saturday, adding that there has been no indication of a specific reason why Santiago&mdash;who authorities say acted alone&mdash;chose the Fort Lauderdale airport.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBroward County Commissioner Chip LaMarca, who was briefed on the shooting by the sheriff&rsquo;s office, told the AP that Santiago arrived in Fort Lauderdale aboard a flight with a gun in a checked bag.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EA military spokeswoman told the AP that Santiago&mdash;who had been living in Anchorage, Alaska&mdash;was discharged from the Alaska Army National Guard last year for unsatisfactory performance. The Pentagon said Santiago went AWOL multiple times and was demoted and then discharged, the AP reported.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EPrior to that, Santiago was deployed to Iraq for a year in 2010, a spokesman for the Puerto Rico National Guard told the AP.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe suspect visited an FBI field office in November\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EPiro, who is in charge of the Miami field office leading the investigation, confirmed reports that Santiago had visited the FBI field office in Anchorage, Alaska in November.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;He walked in, as anyone has the right to do so,&rdquo; Piro said at Saturday&#8217;s press conference. &ldquo;It was during that contact that the agents, themselves, noted the erratic behavior that concerned them.&rdquo; Piro said Santiago was taken into custody at that time and referred to a facility for mental health treatment.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EThe airport has resumed operations\u003Cbr \u002F\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003EWhile the airport halted all flights arriving at or departing from Fort Lauderdale airport Friday, the airport resumed operations on Saturday, encouraging travelers to check with their airline for potential remaining cancellations.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe airport said it was collecting and processing 20,000 bags that were left behind during the chaotic evacuation.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Five people ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ffortune.com\u002Ffortune500\u002Fdelta-air-lines-68\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["Delta Air Lines"]}," and Air Canada, the Associated Press
