Broward County Sheriff's Office identified the gunman as ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4627231\u002Ffort-lauderdale-airport-shooting-suspect\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["26-year-old Esteban Santiago"]},", who is expected to appear in federal court on Monday. He was taken into custody unharmed Friday and was questioned by law enforcement."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["At a press conference Saturday morning, FBI agent George Piro said investigators are continuing to explore terrorism as a potential motive."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["“The indication is that he came here to carry out this horrific attack. We have not identified any triggers that would have caused this attack,” Piro said Saturday, adding that there has been no indication of a specific reason why Santiago—who authorities say acted alone—chose the Fort Lauderdale airport."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Broward County Commissioner Chip LaMarca, who was briefed on the shooting by the sheriff’s office, told the AP that Santiago arrived in Fort Lauderdale aboard a flight with a gun in a checked bag."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["A military spokeswoman told the AP that Santiago—who had been living in Anchorage, Alaska—was discharged from the Alaska Army National Guard last year for unsatisfactory performance. The Pentagon said Santiago went AWOL multiple times and was demoted and then discharged, the AP reported."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Prior to that, Santiago was deployed to Iraq for a year in 2010, a spokesman for the Puerto Rico National Guard told the AP."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["The suspect visited an FBI field office in November",{"tag":"br","attributes":[],"content":[]}]},"Piro, who is in charge of the Miami field office leading the investigation, confirmed reports that Santiago had visited the FBI field office in Anchorage, Alaska in November."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["“He walked in, as anyone has the right to do so,” Piro said at Saturday's press conference. “It was during that contact that the agents, themselves, noted the erratic behavior that concerned them.” Piro said Santiago was taken into custody at that time and referred to a facility for mental health treatment."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"strong","attributes":[],"content":["The airport has resumed operations",{"tag":"br","attributes":[],"content":[]}]},"While the airport halted all flights arriving at or departing from Fort Lauderdale airport Friday, the airport resumed operations on Saturday, encouraging travelers to check with their airline for potential remaining cancellations."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The airport said it was collecting and processing 20,000 bags that were left behind during the chaotic evacuation."]}],"plain":"Five people were killed in a baggage-claim shooting at Florida&#8217;s Fort Lauderdale&ndash;Hollywood International Airport on Friday afternoon. The FBI is still investigating the incident. Here are the key details to know right now: Five people were killed The gunman killed five people and wounded six others, Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel said at a press conference Saturday morning, correcting an initial statement from authorities that had said eight were wounded. The six gunshot-wound victims were taken to local hospitals, where three are in good condition and three remain in intensive care as of Saturday morning. The shooting took place in the baggage claim area of Terminal 2, which serves Delta Air Lines and Air Canada, the Associated Press reported. The shooter pulled a gun out of his luggage and shot at travelers in the area before throwing his weapon down and lying spread-eagle on the ground, the AP reported, citing witnesses. An additional 37 people were later taken to area hospitals with minor injuries resulting from the panic, including chest pain, anxiety and fall injuries. The lone suspect is in custody The Broward County Sheriff&#8217;s Office identified the gunman as 26-year-old Esteban Santiago, who is expected to appear in federal court on Monday. He was taken into custody unharmed Friday and was questioned by law enforcement. At a press conference Saturday morning, FBI agent George Piro said investigators are continuing to explore terrorism as a potential motive. &ldquo;The indication is that he came here to carry out this horrific attack. We have not identified any triggers that would have caused this attack,&rdquo; Piro said Saturday, adding that there has been no indication of a specific reason why Santiago&mdash;who authorities say acted alone&mdash;chose the Fort Lauderdale airport. Broward County Commissioner Chip LaMarca, who was briefed on the shooting by the sheriff&rsquo;s office, told the AP that Santiago arrived in Fort Lauderdale aboard a flight with a gun in a checked bag. A military spokeswoman told the AP that Santiago&mdash;who had been living in Anchorage, Alaska&mdash;was discharged from the Alaska Army National Guard last year for unsatisfactory performance. The Pentagon said Santiago went AWOL multiple times and was demoted and then discharged, the AP reported. Prior to that, Santiago was deployed to Iraq for a year in 2010, a spokesman for the Puerto Rico National Guard told the AP. The suspect visited an FBI field office in November Piro, who is in charge of the Miami field office leading the investigation, confirmed reports that Santiago had visited the FBI field office in Anchorage, Alaska in November. &ldquo;He walked in, as anyone has the right to do so,&rdquo; Piro said at Saturday&#8217;s press conference. &ldquo;It was during that contact that the agents, themselves, noted the erratic behavior that concerned them.&rdquo; Piro said Santiago was taken into custody at that time and referred to a facility for mental health treatment. The airport has resumed operations While the airport halted all flights arriving at or departing from Fort Lauderdale airport Friday, the airport resumed operations on Saturday, encouraging travelers to check with their airline for potential remaining cancellations. The airport said it was collecting and processing 20,000 bags that were left behind during the chaotic evacuation."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe suspect has been taken into custody\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":99231085,"featured_media":4626825,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[2454,3898,1657,430939235],"time_section":[204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937772],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":true,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4626679"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4626679"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4626679"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4626679\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune:n Israel said it’s “too early” to say whether terrorism played a role in the attack."]}],"plain":"A thin rainbow broke out through the clouds above the Florida airport where a gunman killed five people, prompting many on social media to say it was a symbol of hope amid tragedy. Dozens of Twitter users posted the image of the sliver of colors in the sky over the Fort Lauderdale&ndash;Hollywood International Airport about three hours after the mass shooting. One user who was in a car stuck in traffic near the airport said the rainbow was a &ldquo;sign that good will always win.&rdquo; &ldquo;Hope from the tarmac,&rdquo; another person tweeted. People Killed in Shooting at Fort Lauderdale Airport"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626679\u002Ffort-lauderdale-airport-shooting-what-know\u002F\"\u003EFive people were killed \u003C\u002Fa\u003Eand at least eight were injured in a Friday afternoon shooting at\u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.broward.org\u002Fairport\u002FPages\u002FDefault.aspx\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E Florida&#8217;s Fort Lauderdale&ndash;Hollywood International Airport\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, sparking panic among travelers, who ran out onto the tarmac to escape.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe eight people who were injured are being treated at local hospitals, but the degree of their injuries is still unknown, Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel said in a press conference Friday afternoon.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe suspected gunman was taken into custody unharmed and is being interviewed by law enforcement officers, Israel said, adding that it appears he acted alone, but the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4626500\u002Ffort-lauderdale-airport-attack-target\u002F\"\u003Einvestigation is still ongoing\u003C\u002Fa\u003E.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EIsrael said it&#8217;s too early to say whether terrorism was a factor in the attack, which took place in Terminal 2 in the baggage claim area outside the TSA checkpoint. Despite concern that spread on social media, he said there has been no confirmation of another shooter or gunshots fired in another part of the airport.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EBroward County commissioner Chip LaMarca, who was briefed on the airport shooting by Broward Sheriff&#8217;s office, told the Associated Press that the shooter arrived in Fort Lauderdale aboard a flight with a gun in a checked bag.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EHe opened fire on passengers in the baggage claim area before throwing down his weapon and lying spread-eagle on the ground until he was arrested, the AP reported.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAuthorities have not released official information about the suspect&#8217;s identity. But Florida Sen. Bill Nelson said the gunman was carrying a military ID bearing the name Esteban Santiago, the AP reported. It&rsquo;s not clear if the military ID belonged to him, but in an interview on CNN, Florida Sen. Marco Rubio also confirmed that name.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAt a press conference Friday evening, Florida Gov. Rick Scott said he had reached out to and spoken with President-elect Donald Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence multiple times. Asked if he had also reached out to President Obama, he said he had not.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ETrump \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FrealDonaldTrump\u002Fstatus\u002F817453219613917185\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Etweeted\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that he was sending prayers to the victims. &#8220;Monitoring the terrible situation in Florida,&#8221; he wrote. &#8220;Just spoke to Governor Scott. Thoughts and prayers for all. Stay safe!&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe airport \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FFLLFlyer\u002Fstatus\u002F817443211908149253\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Etweeted\u003C\u002Fa\u003E just before 2 pm EST that all services have been temporarily suspended, and \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FFLLFlyer\u002Fstatus\u002F817456975042723841\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Efollowed up\u003C\u002Fa\u003E about an hour later saying the airport will remain closed for an &#8220;extended period of time.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAirport Director Mark Gale said he&#8217;s not sure when the airport will resume normal operations.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;In the meantime, as the sheriff has indicated, we&rsquo;re just going to go step by step methodically through the building before we open up operations,&#8221; Gale said at the press conference.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EStephanie Auclair was at the airport with her parents when the shooting occurred. She told \u003Cem\u003EPEOPLE\u003C\u002Fem\u003E, &ldquo;When you see a bunch of people running toward you, screaming, &lsquo;Shooter! Shooter,&rsquo; it stops your heart.&rdquo; Auclair and her parents hid in the kitchen of an airport restaurant.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EFormer White House Press Secretary under George W. Bush Ari Fleischer was tweeting from the airport while the shooting occurred, \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FAriFleischer\u002Fstatus\u002F817429795113996288?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Ewriting\u003C\u002Fa\u003E, &#8220;Shots have been fired. Bush Ari Fleischer was tweeting from the airport while the shooting occurred, ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FAriFleischer\u002Fstatus\u002F817429795113996288?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw"},"content":["writing"]},", \"Shots have been fired. Everyone is running.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["This is a breaking story please check back for more updates."]}]}],"plain":"Five people were killed and at least eight were injured in a Friday afternoon shooting at Florida&#8217;s Fort Lauderdale&ndash;Hollywood International Airport, sparking panic among travelers, who ran out onto the tarmac to escape. The eight people who were injured are being treated at local hospitals, but the degree of their injuries is still unknown, Broward County Sheriff Scott Israel said in a press conference Friday afternoon. The suspected gunman was taken into custody unharmed and is being interviewed by law enforcement officers, Israel said, adding that it appears he acted alone, but the investigation is still ongoing. Israel said it&#8217;s too early to say whether terrorism was a factor in the attack, which took place in Terminal 2 in the baggage claim area outside the TSA checkpoint. Despite concern that spread on social media, he said there has been no confirmation of another shooter or gunshots fired in another part of the airport. Broward County commissioner Chip LaMarca, who was briefed on the airport shooting by Broward Sheriff&#8217;s office, told the Associated Press that the shooter arrived in Fort Lauderdale aboard a flight with a gun in a checked bag. He opened fire on passengers in the baggage claim area before throwing down his weapon and lying spread-eagle on the ground until he was arrested, the AP reported. Authorities have not released official information about the suspect&#8217;s identity. But Florida Sen. Bill Nelson said the gunman was carrying a military ID bearing the name Esteban Santiago, the AP reported. It&rsquo;s not clear if the military ID belonged to him, but in an interview on CNN, Florida Sen. Marco Rubio also confirmed that name. At a press conference Friday evening, Florida Gov. Rick Scott said he had reached out to and spoken with President-elect Donald Trump and Vice President-elect Mike Pence multiple times. Asked if he had also reached out to President Obama, he said he had not. Trump tweeted that he was sending prayers to the victims. &#8220;Monitoring the terrible situation in Florida,&#8221; he wrote. &#8220;Just spoke to Governor Scott. Thoughts and prayers for all. Stay safe!&#8221; The airport tweeted just before 2 pm EST that all services have been temporarily suspended, and followed up about an hour later saying the airport will remain closed for an &#8220;extended period of time.&#8221; Airport Director Mark Gale said he&#8217;s not sure when the airport will resume normal operations. &#8220;In the meantime, as the sheriff has indicated, we&rsquo;re just going to go step by step methodically through the building before we open up operations,&#8221; Gale said at the press conference. Stephanie Auclair was at the airport with her parents when the shooting occurred. She told PEOPLE, &ldquo;When you see a bunch of people running toward you, screaming, &lsquo;Shooter! Shooter,&rsquo; it stops your heart.&rdquo; Auclair and her parents hid in the kitchen of an airport restaurant. Former White House Press Secretary under George W. Bush Ari Fleischer was tweeting from the airport while the shooting occurred, writing, &#8220;Shots have been fired. Everyone is running.&#8221; This is a breaking story please check back for more updates."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EThe Broward County Mayor says a lone shooter was responsible for the There are rules and laws we have to evaluate.”"]}],"plain":"A 10-year-old Florida boy shot and killed himself Thursday after his mother sent him to a room in their apartment for a timeout, police said. Fifth-grader Ian Sevostjanov was acting up before school about 8:30 a.m. when he was told to go into another room. That&rsquo;s where he found a handgun and fatally shot himself with a single bullet, Clearwater police spokesman Rob Shaw said, according to CBS News. His mother, Olga Grusetskaja, 50, &ldquo;was addressing a behavioral issue&rdquo; and appears to have been the only one home when the shooting happened, authorities said. &ldquo;It&rsquo;s a tragedy in all respects,&rdquo; Clearwater Police Chief Dan Slaughter said at a news conference. &ldquo;It&rsquo;s a difficult thing. The family is in distress. They were overcome with grief.&rdquo; Slaughter said the gun appeared to be legally owned. It&rsquo;s unclear which room in the apartment the boy was instructed to go into and where the gun was stored. The boy&rsquo;s parents could not be immediately reached Friday. &ldquo;There are things we have to evaluate even if it is an accident,&rdquo; Slaughter said. &ldquo;Just because an incident is an accident, that doesn&rsquo;t mean [there are] not other things that have to be reviewed from a culpable negligence standpoint. There are rules and laws we have to evaluate.&rdquo;"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EHis mother had sent him to a room, where he found a gun and shot Since then, she had received \"repeated warnings\" about co-sleeping, local authorities said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Investigators said Piche-Pitts woke up \"in a panic\" when her son was unresponsive in October because she knew \"it happened again,\" the affidavit said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Piche-Pitts was also charged with methamphetamine possession earlier this year while she was pregnant with her son, although that case was later dropped, the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fapnews.com\u002F9d34c67721a54451aa4d25328372e071","target":"_blank"},"content":["Associated Press"]}," reports."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["She appeared for a bond hearing Wednesday, but the bond amount is not yet known. It's unclear if Piche-Pitts has a lawyer."]}],"plain":"A Florida woman was arrested this week after two of her newborn babies died while co-sleeping with her despite multiple warnings the mother was given about the dangers of sleeping in the same bed with her infants, authorities said. Erin Piche-Pitts, 25, was charged with aggravated manslaughter of a child Tuesday after her 18-day-old boy died in October when Piche-Pitts fell asleep while bottle-feeding him in her arms in bed, according to an arrest affidavit from the Polk County Sheriff&#8217;s Office. It was the second time Piche-Pitts had a newborn die while co-sleeping. In 2009, the mother&rsquo;s 13-day-old daughter died from asphyxia after Piche-Pitts fell asleep while breastfeeding, authorities said. The first case was deemed an accident. Since then, she had received &#8220;repeated warnings&#8221; about co-sleeping, local authorities said. Investigators said Piche-Pitts woke up &#8220;in a panic&#8221; when her son was unresponsive in October because she knew &#8220;it happened again,&#8221; the affidavit said. Piche-Pitts was also charged with methamphetamine possession earlier this year while she was pregnant with her son, although that case was later dropped, the Associated Press reports. She appeared for a bond hearing Wednesday, but the bond amount is not yet known. It&#8217;s unclear if Piche-Pitts has a lawyer."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EHer 18-day-old boy died after she fell asleep while feeding We want the wall!&#8217; Screaming, &#8216;Prison! Prison! Lock her up!&#8217; I mean, you are going crazy. Now you&#8217;re laid back, you&#8217;re cool, you&#8217;re mellow, right? You&#8217;re basking in the glory of victory,&#8221; the president-elect added. Trump&#8217;s campaign rallies often grew violent, as protesters clashed with supporters. During the campaign, Trump both defended his rallies as the &#8220;safest place you can be&#8221; and encouraged violence at them. At a rally in Iowa in February, he told supporters to &#8220;knock the crap out of&#8221; hecklers. He also offered to pay the legal fees for a support who sucker-punched a protester at a rally in North Carolina. &#8220;Whatever happened to the deplorables, right? Each count carries a maximum of five years' imprisonment. She will appear in court on Dec. 19."]}],"plain":"A Florida woman who believes the Sandy Hook School shooting was a hoax was arrested after making death threats to a parent whose child was killed in the 2012 shooting. Lucy Richards, 57, was allegedly motivated to threaten the parent because she thought the elementary school shooting in Newtown, Conn., never happened, according to a statement from the U.S. Department of Justice. Richards made a series of death threats to the parent, who now lives in South Florida, the statement said. Twenty children and six adults died in the Sandy Hook School shooting in Dec. 2012. Richards faces charges of four counts of transmitting threats. Each count carries a maximum of five years&#8217; imprisonment. She will appear in court on Dec. 19."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EShe believed the shooting was a nation","parent":0,"count":11631,"filter":"raw","all_sections":["us"]}],"fortune:primary_topic":[{}]}}]],"fortune:more":[[{"id":4682990,"date":"2017-02-25T16:47:43","date_gmt":"2017-02-25T21:47:43","guid":{"rendered":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F?p=4682990"},"modified":"2017-02-25T16:22:00","modified_gmt":"2017-02-25T21:22:00","slug":"muhammad-ali-son-detained-airport","type":"post","link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4682990\u002Fmuhammad-ali-son-detained-airport\u002F","title":{"rendered":"Muhammad Ali's Son Detained at Airport and Was Asked 'Are you Muslim?'"},"content":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EMuhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReturning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECamacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EReached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAn airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EDuring his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003ECamacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAli, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Muhammad Ali's son, who bears the boxing great's name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father — a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he's Ali's son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they're Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they're a Muslim,\" Mancini said in a phone interview. \"It's quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: \"Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,\" according to The Courier-Journal's report about the detention."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, \"as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,\" Mancini said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump's efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["\"This has never happened to them before,\" Mancini said. \"They're asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they're Muslims. It doesn't take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson's disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city's most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide."]}],"plain":"Muhammad Ali&#8217;s son, who bears the boxing great&#8217;s name, was detained by immigration officials at a Florida airport and questioned about his ancestry and religion in what amounted to profiling, a family friend said Saturday. Returning from a Black History Month event in Jamaica, Muhammad Ali Jr. and his mother, Khalilah Camacho Ali, were pulled aside and separated from each other while going through the immigration checkpoint on Feb. 7 at Fort Lauderdale-Hollywood International Airport, said Chris Mancini, a family friend and attorney. Camacho Ali was released a short time later after showing a photo of herself with her ex-husband, the former heavyweight boxing champion, Mancini said. But Ali Jr. was not carrying a photo of his world-famous father &mdash; a recipient of the Presidential Medal of Freedom. Ali Jr., 44, who confirmed his Muslim faith, was detained about two hours, despite telling officials that he&#8217;s Ali&#8217;s son and a native-born U.S. citizen, Mancini said. It was the first time Ali Jr. and his mother have ever been asked if they&#8217;re Muslim when re-entering the United States, he said. &#8220;From the way they were treated, from what was said to them, they can come up with no other rational explanation except they fell into a profiling program run by customs, which is designed to obtain information from anyone who says they&#8217;re a Muslim,&#8221; Mancini said in a phone interview. &#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion.&#8221; Reached for comment Friday, a U.S. Customs and Border Protection spokesman said in an email: &#8220;Due to the restrictions of the Privacy Act, the U.S. Customs and Border Protection cannot discuss individual travelers; however, all international travelers arriving in the U.S. are subject to CBP inspection,&#8221; according to The Courier-Journal&#8217;s report about the detention. An airport spokesman referred questions on Saturday to customs and border protection officials. During his detention, Ali Jr. was asked repeatedly about his lineage and his name, &#8220;as if that was a pre-programmed question that was part of a profile,&#8221; Mancini said. Ali Jr. and his mother have been frequent global travelers. The family connects their treatment to President Donald Trump&#8217;s efforts to restrict immigration after calling during his campaign for a ban on Muslims entering the U.S. &#8220;This has never happened to them before,&#8221; Mancini said. &#8220;They&#8217;re asked specifically about their Arabic names. Where they got their names from and whether they&#8217;re Muslims. It doesn&#8217;t take much to connect those dots to what Trump is doing.&#8221; Camacho Ali and Ali Jr. live in Florida. They have not traveled abroad since, and are considering filing a federal lawsuit, he said. Ali, the three-time heavyweight champion and humanitarian, died last June at age 74 after a long battle with Parkinson&#8217;s disease. People lined the streets of Louisville, Kentucky, to say goodbye to the city&#8217;s most celebrated son before a star-studded memorial service watched worldwide."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E&#8220;It&#8217;s quite clear that what triggered his detention was his Arabic name and his religion,&#8221; a family friend and lawyer racially-motivated attack Wednesday night pleaded to parents in India to consider keeping their children from entering the U.S. amid an environment of fear and hysteria.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EJaganmohan Reddy, whose 32-year-old son Alok Madasani was wounded in the shooting, told the \u003Ca target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003E\u003Cem\u003EHindustan Times\u003C\u002Fem\u003E\u003C\u002Fa\u003E that he was worried xenophobia in the U.S. was worsening under President Donald Trump. Reddy said he had asked his son to move back to India before a gunman opened fire, injuring Madasani and killing his son&rsquo;s friend, Srinivas Kuchibhotla.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&ldquo;The situation seems to be pretty bad after Trump took over as the U.S. president,&rdquo; Reddy said. &ldquo;I appeal to all the parents in India not to send their children to the United States in the present circumstances.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"video-container\"\u003E\u003Cvideo id=\"brightcove-player-5335645292001\" data-video-id=\"5335645292001\" data-account=\"293884104\" data-player=\"SJa0Thl7\" data-embed=\"default\" autoplay controls preload=\"auto\" class=\"video-js responsive-video\"\u003E\u003C\u002Fvideo\u003E\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EAuthorities said 51-year-old Adam Purinton was charged with murder and attempted murder over the shooting. Witnesses said he yelled &ldquo;get out of my county&rdquo; at the men before firing multiple rounds at them, according to the \u003Ca href=\"http:\u002F\u002Fbigstory.ap.org\u002Farticle\u002F47372a2f78144dd0be1ab43c4fdd189b\u002Fwitnesses-say-deadly-kansas-shooting-was-racially-motivated\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EAssociated Press\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. Police say it&rsquo;s too soon to rule the incident a hate crime.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe fatal shooting sent waves of sadness across India, where government officials condemned the &ldquo;senseless&rdquo; violence. India&rsquo;s Minister of External Affairs Sushma Swaraj said in a tweet that she was &ldquo;saddened&rdquo; by the incident and said she&rsquo;d work to transport Kuchibhotla&rsquo;s body back to India.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"time-embed time-embed__twitter\" data-provider=\"twitter\" data-url=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FSushmaSwaraj\u002Fstatus\u002F834969533630709760\" \u003E\n\u003Cdiv class=\"embed-twitter\"\u003E\n\u003Cblockquote class=\"twitter-tweet\" data-width=\"500\"\u003E\n\u003Cp lang=\"en\" dir=\"ltr\"\u003EI am shocked at the shooting incident in Kansas in which Srinivas Kuchibhotla has been killed. My heartfelt condolences to bereaved family.\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003E&mdash; Sushma Swaraj (@SushmaSwaraj) \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FSushmaSwaraj\u002Fstatus\u002F834969533630709760\" target=\"_blank\"\u003EFebruary 24, 2017\u003C\u002Fa\u003E\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\u003C\u002Fblockquote\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003C\u002Fdiv\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe U.S. Embassy in New Delhi sent condolences to loved ones of the slain man, saying embassy officials &ldquo;share their grief.&rdquo; &ldquo;We are deeply saddened by this tragic and senseless act,&rdquo; Charg&eacute; d&rsquo;Affaires MaryKay Carlson said in a \u003Ca href=\"https:\u002F\u002Fin.usembassy.gov\u002Fu-s-embassy-condemns-recent-shooting-kansas\u002F\" target=\"_blank\" target=\"_blank\"\u003Estatement\u003C\u002Fa\u003E. &ldquo;The United States is a nation of immigrants and welcomes people from across the world to visit, work, study and live.&rdquo;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n","structured":[{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The father of one of the Indian men who were ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002F4681450\u002Fkansas-gunman-shooting-race-crime\u002F?xid=homepage","target":"_blank"},"content":["shot at a Kansas bar"]}," in what may have been a racially-motivated attack Wednesday night pleaded to parents in India to consider keeping their children from entering the U.S. amid an environment of fear and hysteria."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Jaganmohan Reddy, whose 32-year-old son Alok Madasani was wounded in the shooting, told the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fwww.hindustantimes.com\u002Findia-news\u002Fsrinivas-kuchibhotla-s-family-says-sports-craze-led-him-to-death-alok-s-dad-wants-son-back\u002Fstory-nh0chWgkDD2J01C6TQxh1J.html","target":"_blank"},"content":[{"tag":"em","attributes":[],"content":["Hindustan Times"]}]}," that he was worried xenophobia in the U.S. was worsening under President Donald Trump. Reddy said he had asked his son to move back to India before a gunman opened fire, injuring Madasani and killing his son’s friend, Srinivas Kuchibhotla."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["“The situation seems to be pretty bad after Trump took over as the U.S. president,” Reddy said. “I appeal to all the parents in India not to send their children to the United States in the present circumstances.”"]},{"tag":"video","attributes":{"autoplay":"1","controls":"1","videoid":"5335645292001"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["Authorities said 51-year-old Adam Purinton was charged with murder and attempted murder over the shooting. Witnesses said he yelled “get out of my county” at the men before firing multiple rounds at them, according to the ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Fbigstory.ap.org\u002Farticle\u002F47372a2f78144dd0be1ab43c4fdd189b\u002Fwitnesses-say-deadly-kansas-shooting-was-racially-motivated","target":"_blank"},"content":["Associated Press"]},". Police say it’s too soon to rule the incident a hate crime."]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The fatal shooting sent waves of sadness across India, where government officials condemned the “senseless” violence. India’s Minister of External Affairs Sushma Swaraj said in a tweet that she was “saddened” by the incident and said she’d work to transport Kuchibhotla’s body back to India."]},{"tag":"oembed","attributes":{"raw_html":"&lt;div class=&quot;embed-twitter&quot;&gt;&lt;blockquote class=&quot;twitter-tweet&quot; data-width=&quot;500&quot;&gt;&lt;p lang=&quot;en&quot; dir=&quot;ltr&quot;&gt;I am shocked at the shooting incident in Kansas in which Srinivas Kuchibhotla has been killed. My heartfelt condolences to bereaved family.&lt;\u002Fp&gt;&mdash; Sushma Swaraj (@SushmaSwaraj) &lt;a href=&quot;https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FSushmaSwaraj\u002Fstatus\u002F834969533630709760&quot;&gt;February 24, 2017&lt;\u002Fa&gt;&lt;\u002Fblockquote&gt;&lt;script async src=&quot;\u002F\u002Fplatform.twitter.com\u002Fwidgets.js&quot; charset=&quot;utf-8&quot;&gt;&lt;\u002Fscript&gt;&lt;\u002Fdiv&gt;","type":"twitter","url":"https:\u002F\u002Ftwitter.com\u002FSushmaSwaraj\u002Fstatus\u002F834969533630709760"},"content":[]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The U.S. Embassy in New Delhi sent condolences to loved ones of the slain man, saying embassy officials “share their grief.” “We are deeply saddened by this tragic and senseless act,” Chargé d’Affaires MaryKay Carlson said in a ",{"tag":"a","attributes":{"href":"https:\u002F\u002Fin.usembassy.gov\u002Fu-s-embassy-condemns-recent-shooting-kansas\u002F","target":"_blank"},"content":["statement"]},". “The United States is a nation of immigrants and welcomes people from across the world to visit, work, study and live.”"]}],"plain":"The father of one of the Indian men who were shot at a Kansas bar in what may have been a racially-motivated attack Wednesday night pleaded to parents in India to consider keeping their children from entering the U.S. amid an environment of fear and hysteria. Jaganmohan Reddy, whose 32-year-old son Alok Madasani was wounded in the shooting, told the Hindustan Times that he was worried xenophobia in the U.S. was worsening under President Donald Trump. Reddy said he had asked his son to move back to India before a gunman opened fire, injuring Madasani and killing his son&rsquo;s friend, Srinivas Kuchibhotla. &ldquo;The situation seems to be pretty bad after Trump took over as the U.S. president,&rdquo; Reddy said. &ldquo;I appeal to all the parents in India not to send their children to the United States in the present circumstances.&rdquo; Authorities said 51-year-old Adam Purinton was charged with murder and attempted murder over the shooting. Witnesses said he yelled &ldquo;get out of my county&rdquo; at the men before firing multiple rounds at them, according to the Associated Press. Police say it&rsquo;s too soon to rule the incident a hate crime. The fatal shooting sent waves of sadness across India, where government officials condemned the &ldquo;senseless&rdquo; violence. India&rsquo;s Minister of External Affairs Sushma Swaraj said in a tweet that she was &ldquo;saddened&rdquo; by the incident and said she&rsquo;d work to transport Kuchibhotla&rsquo;s body back to India. I am shocked at the shooting incident in Kansas in which Srinivas Kuchibhotla has been killed. My heartfelt condolences to bereaved family. &mdash; Sushma Swaraj (@SushmaSwaraj) February 24, 2017 The U.S. Embassy in New Delhi sent condolences to loved ones of the slain man, saying embassy officials &ldquo;share their grief.&rdquo; &ldquo;We are deeply saddened by this tragic and senseless act,&rdquo; Charg&eacute; d&rsquo;Affaires MaryKay Carlson said in a statement. &ldquo;The United States is a nation of immigrants and welcomes people from across the world to visit, work, study and live.&rdquo;"},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003E“I appeal to all the parents in India not to send their children to the United he said, alluding to the agency that crafts the President&#8217;s budget. &#8220;If DOE doesn&rsquo;t take care of that on it&rsquo;s own accord, the Office of Management and Budget almost certainly will.&#8221;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n\u003Cp\u003EThe Department of Energy spends billions on research each year, the bulk of which goes to renewable energy projects. Why shouldn't I be in trouble with this one?\""]},{"tag":"p","attributes":[],"content":["The Trump White House did not respond to a request for comment."]}],"plain":"A former top aide on energy issues for President Trump&#8217;s transition speculated that the Administration will cut research funding for wind and solar power and redirect money to fossil fuels. Energy lobbyist Mike McKenna, who headed Trump&#8217;s Department of Energy transition team until late November, told the West Virginia Coal Association that current funding allocations favoring renewable energy would likely be changed. &#8220;The young people have a word for it, it&#8217;s not sustainable,&#8221; he said, alluding to the agency that crafts the President&#8217;s budget. &#8220;If DOE doesn&rsquo;t take care of that on it&rsquo;s own accord, the Office of Management and Budget almost certainly will.&#8221; The Department of Energy spends billions on research each year, the bulk of which goes to renewable energy projects. In the 2016 fiscal year, the agency spent more than $2 billion on energy efficiency and renewable energy, nearly $1 billion on nuclear energy and more than $600 million on fossil energy. Supporters of renewable energy have speculated that the Trump Administration will cut research funding as he undoes Obama-era environmental regulations. Trump has long shown a personal disdain for wind energy in particular, expressing skepticism that it is cost effective and complaining that it kills birds. Still, renewable energy remains popular among many Republicans and Trump&#8217;s choice for Energy Secretary, former Texas Gov. Rick Perry, saw the rapid deployment of wind and solar during his tenure as governor. Some renewable energy research programs, like ARPA-E created under President George W. Bush, generate substantial returns from the projects they fund. McKenna&#8217;s wide-ranging remarks also included a comment on rising concerns among career staff at the Environmental Protection Agency over Scott Pruitt, the agency&#8217;s new head, and his record suing the agency. McKenna is not concerned. &#8220;We&rsquo;re not about assuaging the concerns of the 14,000 employees of the EPA,&#8221; he said. &#8220;We&rsquo;re about assuaging the concerns of the 63 million people who voted for Donald Trump.&#8221; McKenna, who left his role in the transition a few weeks after the election in response to a rule requiring transition officials to de-register as lobbyist, seemed to acknowledge that his remarks would draw controversy. &#8220;That&rsquo;s why I came here to Charleston to say something that would get me in trouble right away with the new Administration,&#8221; he joked. &#8220;I was in trouble with the last one. Why shouldn&#8217;t I be in trouble with this one?&#8221; The Trump White House did not respond to a request for comment."},"excerpt":{"rendered":"\u003Cp\u003EA former top aide on energy issues for President Trump&#8217;s transition speculated that the Administration will cut research funding for wind and solar power and redirect money to fossil fuels. Energy lobbyist Mike McKenna, who headed Trump&#8217;s Department of Energy transition team until late November, told the West Virginia Coal Association that current funding allocations&hellip;\u003C\u002Fp\u003E\n"},"author":66938674,"featured_media":4682302,"comment_status":"closed","ping_status":"closed","sticky":false,"format":"standard","categories":[1],"tags":[1212,13570,70566,109351],"time_section":[204777755,204777754],"money_section":[],"time_topic":[],"primary_time_section":[430937769],"primary_money_section":[],"primary_time_topic":[],"paid":false,"display_modified_time":true,"_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts"}],"author":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fauthor"}],"wp:featuredmedia":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Ffeaturedmedia"}],"wp:term":[{"taxonomy":"category","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories?post=4681719"},{"taxonomy":"post_tag","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags?post=4681719"},{"taxonomy":"topic","embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftopics?post=4681719"}],"wp:meta":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fmeta"}],"wp:attachment":[{"embeddable":false,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fmedia"}],"fortune:featured":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Ffeatured"}],"fortune:related":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Frelated"}],"fortune:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fauthors"}],"fortune:newsletter":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fnewsletter"}],"fortune:more":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fmore"}],"fortune:popular":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fpopular"}],"fortune:listicle":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Flisticle"}],"fortune:gallery":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fgallery"}],"fortune:primary_tag":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fprimary_tag"}],"fortune:primary_section":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fprimary_section"}],"fortune:primary_topic":[{"embeddable":true,"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fprimary_topic"}],"ng:more:brand":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fposts\u002F4681719\u002Fbrand"}],"ng:authors":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fauthors?post=4681719"}]},"_embedded":{"wp:term":[[{"id":1,"link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fcategory\u002Funcategorized\u002F","name":"Uncategorized","slug":"uncategorized","taxonomy":"category","_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories\u002F1"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Fcategories"}],"about":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Ftaxonomies\u002Fcategory"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fposts?categories=1"},{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-jso Power","slug":"solar-power","taxonomy":"post_tag","_links":{"self":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags\u002F70566"}],"collection":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fti-api\u002Fv1\u002Ftags"}],"about":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Ftaxonomies\u002Fpost_tag"}],"wp:post_type":[{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fposts?tags=70566"},{"href":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Fwp-json\u002Fwp\u002Fv2\u002Fmoney_article?tags=70566"}],"curies":[{"name":"wp","href":"https:\u002F\u002Fapi.w.org\u002F{rel}","templated":true}]}},{"id":109351,"link":"http:\u002F\u002Ftime.com\u002Ftag\u002Fwind-power\u002F","name":"wind
